children.name: Object
children.text:
GlideURI object representing the URI parameter of the user view.
  • GlideURI
  • GlideURI - Global

children.name: Example
children.text: var uri = action.getGlideURI(); var path = 'catalog_home.do'; uri.set('sysparm_view', 'catalog_default'); action.setRedirectURL(uri.toString(path));
children.text2:
The following  shows how to get the user view and set the redirect URL to the
        service catalog home page.

children.name: getGlideURI()
children.text: Gets a GlideURI object to determine the user view.

children.name: Example
children.text: action.getReturnURL();

children.name: String
children.text: URL of the return page in view after a UI action is complete.

children.name: getReturnURL()
children.text: Gets the URL of the return page in view after a UI action is complete.

children.name: Example
children.text: action.getURLParameter('sysparm_query');

children.name: String
children.text: URL parameter value.

children.name: parameterName
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the URL parameter name to be queried for the URL parameter
                value.

children.name: getURLParameter(String parameterName)
children.text: Gets the value of a URL parameter.

children.name: gr
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2: GlideRecord of the page to be opened in the user view.

children.name: Example
children.text: if(current.update()){ var inc = new GlideRecord("incident"); inc.newRecord(); inc.caller_id = current.opened_for; inc.short_description = current.short_description; action.openGlideRecord(inc); }
children.text2: The following shows how to include the caller name and incident description created from an interaction record. For more details, see Set up custom UI actions in Workspace.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: openGlideRecord(Object gr)
children.text: Opens a page with a GlideRecord in the user view.

children.name: noPop
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag indicating whether to enable or disable pop-up windows on the page:
  • true: Disables pop-up windows.
  • false: Default. Enables pop-up windows.

children.name: Example
children.text: action.setNoPop(true);
children.text2: The following  shows how to disable pop-up windows for a UI action.

children.name: setNoPop(Boolean noPop)
children.text:
Indicates whether to enable or disable pop-up windows on the page in the current
    view.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var fixchg = new GlideRecord("change_request"); fixchg.short_description= current.short_description; fixchg.comments= current.comments.getHTMLValue(); // fixchg.parent = current.sys_id; fixchg.insert(); FixChange(); gs.addInfoMessage("Change "+ fixchg.number+" created"); action.setRedirectURL(current); action.setReturnURL(fixchg); function FixChange(){ var m2m = new GlideRecord('task_rel_task'); m2m.initialize(); m2m.child= current.sys_id; m2m.parent= fixchg.sys_id; m2m.type.setDisplayValue("Fixes::Fixed by"); m2m.insert();}
children.text2: The following shows how to redirect a user to a URL from a UI action using the current variable.

children.name: URL
children.text: Object
children.text2: URL to set as the redirect. You can provide the URL as a string or a GlideRecord. If you pass the URL as a GlideRecord, this value takes the focus to that record's form.

children.name: setRedirectURL(Object URL)
children.text:
Sets the redirect URI for this transaction, which determines the next page the user
    sees.
children.text2:
For use cases:

  • Create a UI routing action
  • Create knowledge articles from HR cases
  • Define task relationships with UI actions

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: URL
children.text: Object
children.text2: URI to set as the return location after a UI action is complete. You can provide the URL as a string or a GlideRecord.

children.name: Example
children.text: var change = new GlideRecord("change_request"); change.initialize(); change.short_description = current.short_description; change.description = current.u_details; change.cmdb_ci = current.u_service; change.priority = current.priority; change.requested_by = current.caller_id; change.assignment_group.setDisplayValue('Change & Release'); change.u_status = 'New'; change.parent = current.number; change.applyTemplate("standard_rfc"); current.rfc = change.insert(); current.comments = 'Change ' + change.number + ' created.'; var mySysID = current.update(); gs.addInfoMessage("Change " + change.number + " created"); action.setRedirectURL(change); action.setReturnURL(current);
children.text2: The following enables the user to select the UI action to create a change record using information from the problem record and the change template. After the change, the user returns to current view. For more information, see Scripted templates. For more use cases, see Define task relationships with UI actions.

children.name: setReturnURL(Object URL)
children.text:
Sets the return URI for this transaction after a UI action is complete. You can use
    this method to determine what page the user has in view when they return from
    submit.

children.name: parameterName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the URL parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: action.setURLParameter('sysparm_query', 'priority=2^active=true');

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: parameterValue
children.text: String
children.text2: Value of the parameter.

children.name: setURLParameter(String parameterName, String parameterValue)
children.text: Sets a URL parameter name and value.

name: action - Scoped, Global
text: Enables handling data for URLs in a UI action script.
text2:
Use the action API to configure UI actions with which users can interact. Use these scripts in the UI Action [sys_ui_action] table. For information, see UI actions.

Methods for this API are referred to by the variable name 'action' in any server-side JavaScript. To learn more, see Creating interactions with UI actions.

children.name: CertificateEncryption()
children.text: Instantiates a CertificateEncryption object in a scoped application.

children.name: Example
children.text: var mac = new CertificateEncryption; var key = "sample_key"; key = gs.base64Encode(key); mac.generateMac(key, "HmacSHA256", "sample_data");
children.text2:
This  shows how to a MAC using sample_key as the data and HmacSHA256 as the
        algorithm.

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2: Key to use to sign the message. Must be Base64 encoded.

children.name: String
children.text: MAC in base64 format.

children.name: algorithm
children.text: String
children.text2:
Algorithm to use to generate the MAC: HmacSHA256, HmacSHA1, HmacMD5, and so
                on.

children.name: data
children.text: String
children.text2: Data to process.

children.name: generateMac(String key, String algorithm, String data)
children.text:
Generates the Message Authentication Code (MAC), which is used to authenticate a
    message.

children.name: Output
children.text: V1X+aguDBTZVVbWMGTXxdzJLmaY=

children.name: Example
children.text: //Create a GlideRecord to the certificate table var x509GR = new GlideRecord('sys_certificate'); //If there is a certificate of a name of AzureAAD, get the certificate thumbprint if(x509GR.get('name', 'AzureAAD')){ //Use the sys_id and algorithm we want to create a thumbprint var thumbPrint = CertificateEncryption.getThumbPrint(x509GR.getUniqueValue(), "SHA-1"); //Print the created thumbprint gs.print("Thumbprint for " + x509GR.getDisplayValue() + " is " + thumbPrint); }
children.text2: This  shows how to generate the thumbprint (hash) for the AzureAAD certificate.

children.name: String
children.text: Thumbprint in base64 format.

children.name: certificateID
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the certificate record in the X.509 Certificate [sys_certificate]
                table.

children.name: algorithm
children.text: String
children.text2: Algorithm to use to create the hash, such as SHA-1, SHA-256, and so on.

children.name: getThumbPrint(String certificateID, String algorithm)
children.text:
Generates a hash (SHA-1, SHA-256, and so on) for the certificate from Trust Store
    Cert.

children.name: certificateID
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of the certificate record in the X.509 Certificate [sys_certificate]
                table.

children.name: String
children.text: Thumbprint in base64 format.

children.name: alias
children.text: String
children.text2: Alias name for the certificate.

children.name: algorithm
children.text: String
children.text2: Algorithm to use to create the hash, such as SHA-1, SHA-256, and so on.

children.name: getThumbPrintFromKeystore(String certificateID, String alias, String algorithm)
children.text:
Generates a hash (SHA-1, SHA-256, and so on) for the certificate from the keystore
    entry.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ce = new CertificateEncryption; ce.sign("recordID", "alias", "password", "SHA1withRSA", "sign this data");

children.name: String
children.text: Signed data in base64 format.

children.name: certificateID
children.text: String
children.text2:
sys_id of the certificate record in the X.509 Certificate [sys_certificate]
                table.

children.name: alias
children.text: String
children.text2: Private key name.

children.name: aliaspassword
children.text: String
children.text2: Password for the private key.

children.name: algorithm
children.text: String
children.text2:
Algorithm to use. Must be one of the following values:
  • NONEwithRSA
  • MD2withRSA
  • MD5withRSA
  • SHA1withRSA
  • SHA224withRSA
  • SHA256withRSA
  • SHA384withRSA
  • SHA512withRSA
  • NONEwithDSA
  • SHA1withDSA
  • SHA224withDSA
  • SHA256withDSA
  • NONEwithECDSA
  • SHA1withECDSA
  • SHA224withECDSA
  • SHA256withECDSA
  • SHA384withECDSA
  • SHA512withECDSA

children.name: datatosign
children.text: String
children.text2: Data to sign.

children.name: sign(String certificateID, String alias, String aliaspassword, String algorithm, String datatosign)
children.text: Signs the data using the private key and the specified algorithm.

name: CertificateEncryption
text: APIs available for encrypting certificates in scoped applications.
text2:
Use these methods to generate a hash for the certificate, sign data using a private key, and
   generate a message authentication code.

children.name: Output
children.text: 4ecead85c4da0010598d0c7c6bf73554

children.name: Example
children.text: var contextId = FlowScriptAPI.getContextID(); return contextId;
children.text2: This assumes you have created a flow containing a Log action. This inline script generates the content of the Log message.

children.name: String
children.text: The sys_id of the running flow.

children.name: getContextID()
children.text: Returns the context ID of the running flow.

name: FlowScriptAPI
text: A FlowScriptAPI object allows you to access Flow Designer context details from script steps and inline scripts.
text2:
You cannot instantiate objects of this type. Objects of this type are created automatically
      and are accessible only in  script steps and inline scripts.

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident');

children.name: tableName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the table.

children.name: GlideAggregate(String tableName)
children.text: Creates a GlideAggregate object on the specified table.

children.name: Output
children.text:
COUNT: 13
SUM: 273
AVG: 21.0000
MIN: 3
MAX: 95
STDDEV: 32.7694

children.name: Example
children.text: var incidentGA = new GlideAggregate('incident'); incidentGA.addQuery('category', 'software'); incidentGA.setGroup(false); incidentGA.addAggregate('COUNT', 'sys_mod_count'); incidentGA.addAggregate('SUM', 'sys_mod_count'); incidentGA.addAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); incidentGA.addAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); incidentGA.addAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); incidentGA.addAggregate('STDDEV', 'sys_mod_count'); incidentGA.query(); if (incidentGA.next()) { gs.info('COUNT: ' + incidentGA.getAggregate('COUNT', 'sys_mod_count')); gs.info('SUM: ' + incidentGA.getAggregate('SUM', 'sys_mod_count')); gs.info('AVG: ' + incidentGA.getAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count')); gs.info('MIN: ' + incidentGA.getAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count')); gs.info('MAX: ' + incidentGA.getAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count')); gs.info('STDDEV: ' + incidentGA.getAggregate('STDDEV', 'sys_mod_count')); }
children.text2:
The following  shows how to add aggregates to a query on the category and software
        fields in the Incident [incident] table.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: agg
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of an aggregate to use.
Valid values:
  • AVG
  • COUNT
  • MIN
  • MAX
  • STDDEV
  • SUM

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Name of the field to group the results of the aggregation by.

Default: Null

children.name: addAggregate(String agg, String name)
children.text: Adds an aggregate to a database query.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: query
children.text: String
children.text2: An encoded query to add to the aggregate.

children.name: Example
children.text: //Number of incidents varies depending on the current state //of the incident table var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addEncodedQuery('active=true'); count.addAggregate('COUNT'); count.query(); var incidents = 0; if (count.next()) incidents = count.getAggregate('COUNT'); gs.info(incidents);

children.name: addEncodedQuery(String query)
children.text:
Adds an encoded query to the other queries that may have been set for this
    aggregate.

children.name: GlideQueryCondition
children.text: The scoped query condition.

children.name: fieldname
children.text: String
children.text2: The name of the field.

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addNotNullQuery('short_description'); count.query(); // Issue the query to the database to get all records while (count.next()) { // add code here to process the aggregate }

children.name: addNotNullQuery(String fieldName)
children.text: Adds a not null query to the aggregate.

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: The name of the field.

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addNullQuery('short_description'); count.query(); // Issue the query to the database to get all records while (count.next()) { // add code here to process the aggregate }

children.name: GlideQueryCondition
children.text: The scoped query condition.

children.name: addNullQuery(String fieldName)
children.text: Adds a null query to the aggregate.

children.name: Output
children.text:
There are currently 1 incidents with a category of database
There are currently 5 incidents with a category of hardware
There are currently 42 incidents with a category of inquiry
There are currently 4 incidents with a category of network
There are currently 4 incidents with a category of request
There are currently 7 incidents with a category of software

children.name: Example
children.text: //Number of incidents varies depending on the current state //of the incident table var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addQuery('active', '=','true'); count.addAggregate('COUNT', 'category'); count.query(); while (count.next()) { var category = count.category; var categoryCount = count.getAggregate('COUNT', 'category'); gs.info("There are currently " + categoryCount + " incidents with a category of " + category); }

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: The query to add.

children.name: GlideQueryCondition
children.text: The query condition.

children.name: operator
children.text: String
children.text2: The operator for the query.

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: The list of values to include in the query.

children.name: addQuery(String name, String operator, String value)
children.text: Adds a query to the aggregate.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field for which trending should occur.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ga = new GlideAggregate('incident'); ga.addAggregate('COUNT'); // Count all incidents opened each quarter ga.addTrend('opened_at', 'quarter'); ga.query(); while(ga.next()) { gs.info([ga.getValue('timeref'), ga.getAggregate('COUNT')]); }

children.name: timeInterval
children.text: String
children.text2:
Time interval for the trend.
Valid values:
  • date
  • dayofweek
  • hour
  • minute
  • quarter
  • value
  • week
  • year

children.name: numUnits
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Optional. Only valid when timeInterval = minute. Number of minutes to include in the trend.

Default: 1

children.name: addTrend(String fieldName, String timeInterval, Number numUnits)
children.text: Adds a trend for a specified field.

children.name: agg
children.text: String
children.text2: The type of the aggregate. For example, SUM or COUNT.

children.name: Output
children.text2: Number of incidents: 63

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('COUNT'); count.query(); var incidents = 0; if (count.next()) { incidents = count.getAggregate('COUNT'); } //Number of incidents varies depending on the current state //of the incident table gs.info('Number of incidents: ' + incidents);
children.text2: Shows an aggregation that returns the number of records in the Incident table.

children.name: String
children.text:
The value of the aggregation.
If the values being aggregated are FX Currency values, the returned value is in the format <currency_code;currency_value>, such as: USD;134.980000.
Note: If the specified field contains FX Currency values of mixed currency types, the method is not able to aggregate the values and returns a semicolon (;).

children.name: Output
children.text2: *** Script: Aggregate results Toshiba => USD;9385.202875800000

children.name: Example
children.text: var ga = new GlideAggregate('laptop_tracker'); ga.addAggregate('SUM', 'cost'); ga.groupBy('name'); ga.query(); while (ga.next()) { gs.info('Aggregate results ' + ga.getValue('name') + ' => ' + ga.getAggregate('SUM', 'cost')); }
children.text2: Shows the aggregation of an FX Currency field.

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field on which to perform the aggregation.

children.name: getAggregate(String agg, String name)
children.text: Returns the value of an aggregate from the current record.

children.name: Output
children.text:
category=database
category=hardware
category=inquiry
category=network
category=request
category=software

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); count.groupBy('category'); count.query(); while (count.next()) { gs.info(count.getAggregateEncodedQuery()); }

children.name: String
children.text: The encoded query to get the aggregate.

children.name: getAggregateEncodedQuery()
children.text: Gets the query necessary to return the current aggregate.

children.name: Output
children.text: ORDERBYcategory^GROUPBYcategory

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); count.groupBy('category'); count.query(); gs.info(count.getEncodedQuery());

children.name: String
children.text: The encoded query.

children.name: getEncodedQuery()
children.text: Retrieves the encoded query.

children.name: Output
children.text:
6
Database Update counts: MIN = 8 MAX = 48 AVG = 28.0000
Hardware Update counts: MIN = 4 MAX = 14 AVG = 6.6250
Inquiry / Help Update counts: MIN = 0 MAX = 34 AVG = 6.5714
Network Update counts: MIN = 3 MAX = 37 AVG = 18.6000
Request Update counts: MIN = 5 MAX = 39 AVG = 13.4000
Software Update counts: MIN = 4 MAX = 98 AVG = 24.0000

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); count.groupBy('category'); count.query(); gs.info(count.getRowCount()); while (count.next()) { var min = count.getAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); var max = count.getAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); var avg = count.getAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); var category = count.category.getDisplayValue(); gs.info(category + " Update counts: MIN = " + min + " MAX = " + max + " AVG = " + avg); }

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of rows in the GlideAggregate object.

children.name: getRowCount()
children.text: Retrieves the number of rows in the GlideAggregate object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); count.groupBy('category'); count.query(); gs.info(count.getTableName());

children.name: String
children.text: The table name.

children.name: getTableName()
children.text: Retrieves the table name associated with this GlideAggregate object.

children.name: String
children.text: Value of the specified field.

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field within the current table to return.

children.name: Output
children.text:
category had 12 updates
hardware category had 15 updates
inquiry category had 36 updates
network category had 37 updates
software category had 95 updates

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); count.groupBy('category'); count.query(); while (count.next()) { gs.info(count.getValue('category') + " category had " + count.getAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count') + " updates"); }

children.name: getValue(String name)
children.text: Returns the value of the specified field.

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field.

children.name: Output
children.text:
Database Update counts: MIN = 8 MAX = 48 AVG = 28.0000
Hardware Update counts: MIN = 4 MAX = 14 AVG = 6.6250
Inquiry / Help Update counts: MIN = 0 MAX = 34 AVG = 6.5714
Network Update counts: MIN = 3 MAX = 37 AVG = 18.6000
Request Update counts: MIN = 5 MAX = 39 AVG = 13.4000
Software Update counts: MIN = 4 MAX = 98 AVG = 24.0000

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); count.addAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); count.groupBy('category'); count.query(); while (count.next()) { var min = count.getAggregate('MIN', 'sys_mod_count'); var max = count.getAggregate('MAX', 'sys_mod_count'); var avg = count.getAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); var category = count.category.getDisplayValue(); gs.info(category + " Update counts: MIN = " + min + " MAX = " + max + " AVG = " + avg); }

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: groupBy(String name)
children.text: Provides the name of a field to use in grouping the aggregates.
children.text2: May be called numerous times to set multiple group fields.

children.name: Output
children.text:
Database: AVG = 32.5000
Hardware: AVG = 12.0000
Inquiry / Help: AVG = 7.6667
Network: AVG = 24.0000
Request: AVG = 16.4000
Software: AVG = 27.0833

children.name: Example
children.text: var agg = new GlideAggregate('incident'); agg.addAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); agg.groupBy('category'); agg.query(); while (agg.hasNext()) { agg.next(); var avg = agg.getAggregate('AVG', 'sys_mod_count'); var category = agg.category.getDisplayValue(); gs.info(category + ': AVG = ' + avg); }

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if there are more results in the query set.

children.name: hasNext()
children.text: Determines if there are any more records in the GlideAggregate object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('COUNT'); count.query(); var incidents = 0; if (count.next()) { incidents = count.getAggregate('COUNT'); gs.info(incidents); }

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if there are more records in the query set; otherwise, false.

children.name: next()
children.text: Moves to the next record in the GlideAggregate.

children.name: Output
children.text:
database: Current number of incidents:2
hardware: Current number of incidents:8
inquiry: Current number of incidents:28
network: Current number of incidents:5
request: Current number of incidents:5
software: Current number of incidents:11

children.name: Example
children.text: var agg = new GlideAggregate('incident'); agg.addAggregate('count', 'category'); agg.orderBy('category'); agg.query(); while (agg.next()) { var category = agg.category; var count = agg.getAggregate('count', 'category'); var agg2 = new GlideAggregate('incident'); agg2.addAggregate('count', 'category'); agg2.orderBy('category'); gs.info(category + ": Current number of incidents:" + count); }

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field to order the aggregates by.

children.name: orderBy(String name)
children.text:
Orders the aggregates using the value of the specified field. The field will also be
    added to the group-by list.

children.name: Output
children.text:
Category inquiry 18
Category software 11
Category hardware 7
Category network 5
Category request 5
Category  4
Category database 2

children.name: Example
children.text: ga.addAggregate(‘COUNT’, ‘category’); ga.orderByAggregate('count', 'category'); ga.query(); while(ga.next()) { gs.info(‘Category ’ + ga.category + ‘ ‘ + ga.getAggregate(‘COUNT’, ‘category’)); }

children.name: agg
children.text: String
children.text2: Type of aggregation.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field to aggregate.

children.name: orderByAggregate(String agg, String fieldName)
children.text: Orders the aggregates based on the specified aggregate and field.

children.name: Output
children.text:
software: Current number of incidents:11
request: Current number of incidents:5
network: Current number of incidents:5
inquiry: Current number of incidents:28
hardware: Current number of incidents:8
database: Current number of incidents:2

children.name: Example
children.text: var agg = new GlideAggregate('incident'); agg.addAggregate('count', 'category'); agg.orderByDesc('category'); agg.query(); while (agg.next()) { var category = agg.category; var count = agg.getAggregate('count', 'category'); var agg2 = new GlideAggregate('incident'); agg2.addAggregate('count', 'category'); agg2.orderBy('category'); gs.info(category + ": Current number of incidents:" + count); }

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the field.

children.name: orderByDesc(String name)
children.text:
Sorts the aggregates in descending order based on the specified field. The field will
    also be added to the group-by list.

children.name: Example
children.text: var count = new GlideAggregate('incident'); count.addAggregate('COUNT'); count.query(); var incidents = 0; if (count.next()) { incidents = count.getAggregate('COUNT'); } gs.info('Number of incidents: ' + incidents);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: query()
children.text: Issues the query and gets the results.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: b
children.text: Boolean
children.text2: When true the results are grouped.

children.name: Output
children.text:
Category database 2
Category hardware 7
Category inquiry 18
Category network 5
Category request 5
Category software 11

children.name: Example
children.text: var ga = new GlideAggregate('incident'); ga.addAggregate('COUNT', 'category'); ga.setGroup(true); ga.groupBy("category"); ga.query(); while(ga.next()) { gs.info('Category ' + ga.category + ' ' + ga.getAggregate('COUNT', 'category')); }

children.name: setGroup(Boolean b)
children.text: Sets whether the results are to be grouped.

name: GlideAggregate
text: GlideAggregate enables creating database aggregation queries.
text2:
The scoped GlideAggregate class is an extension of GlideRecord and provides database aggregation (AVG, COUNT, MIN, MAX, STDDEV, SUM) queries. This functionality can be helpful when creating customized reports or in calculations for calculated fields. The GlideAggregate class works only on number fields.

When you use GlideAggregate on currency or price fields, you are working with the reference currency value. Be sure to convert the aggregate values to the user's session currency for display. Because the conversion rate between the currency or price value (displayed value) and its reference currency value (aggregation value) might change, the result may not be what the user expects.

Note: When using an on-premise system, the database server time zone must be set to GMT/UTC for this class to work properly.

children.name: String
children.text:
Value of the specified application property for the specified domain. If domainSysId is not passed in the call, then returns the session domain.

If the specified application property doesn’t exist, returns the same-name system property value.

If the user does not have access rights to the specified domain, throws an exception and no value is returned.

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the application property to return.
Note: If the application is not global, you must prefix the name of the sys_application_property with the application's scope.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: Value for ACME domain: prop-value-ACME
*** Script: Domain: c90f91924a362312001bdefae0f35d68
*** Script: Value for current session (Cisco) domain: prop-value-Cisco

children.name: Example
children.text: var MY_APP_PROP_NAME = 'my-app-prop'; var ACME_DOMAIN_ID = 'c90d4b084a362312013398f051272c0d'; var CISCO_DOMAIN_ID = 'c90f91924a362312001bdefae0f35d68'; // create a new app_config entry: var now_GR = new GlideRecord('sys_application_property'); now_GR.name = MY_APP_PROP_NAME; now_GR.default_value = 'my-app-prop-default_value'; now_GR.insert(); // Override the value for ACME domain, catch exception if user can't access the specified domain try { GlideApplicationProperty.setValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME, 'prop-value-ACME', ACME_DOMAIN_ID); gs.info('Value for ACME domain: ' + GlideApplicationProperty.getValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME, ACME_DOMAIN_ID)); } catch (ex) { gs.info('Exception: ' + ex); } // Override the value for Cisco domain -- assuming that the current session domain is Cisco. Notice that we don't pass domain-id explicitly session.setDomainID(CISCO_DOMAIN_ID); // NOTE: this API is not available from non-global scope (use domain-picker to switch to Cisco) gs.info('Domain: ' + session.getCurrentDomainID()); GlideApplicationProperty.setValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME, 'prop-value-Cisco'); gs.info('Value for current session (Cisco) domain: ' + GlideApplicationProperty.getValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME));
children.text2:
This  shows how to create a new application property and override its value for ACME
        and Cisco domains.

children.name: domainSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Sys_id of the domain associated with the application property.

Default: Session domain

children.name: getValue(String name, String domainSysId)
children.text: Returns the value for the specified application property and domain sys_id.
children.text2:
The list of available application properties is located in the Application Properties [sys_application_property] and Application Property Values [sys_application_property_value] tables.

Note: If the specified domain is a child domain, and there is not an application property for the child domain, the method returns the parent domain application property, if available.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the save operation was successful.
Valid values:
  • true: Value was successfully saved.
  • false: An error occurred and the application property was not created/updated.

If the user does not have access rights to the specified domain, throws an exception and no value is returned.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: Value for ACME domain: prop-value-ACME
*** Script: Domain: c90f91924a362312001bdefae0f35d68
*** Script: Value for current session (Cisco) domain: prop-value-Cisco

children.name: Example
children.text: var MY_APP_PROP_NAME = 'my-app-prop'; var ACME_DOMAIN_ID = 'c90d4b084a362312013398f051272c0d'; var CISCO_DOMAIN_ID = 'c90f91924a362312001bdefae0f35d68'; // create a new app_config entry: var now_GR = new GlideRecord('sys_application_property'); now_GR.name = MY_APP_PROP_NAME; now_GR.default_value = 'my-app-prop-default_value'; now_GR.insert(); // Override the value for ACME domain, catch exception if user can't access the specified domain try { GlideApplicationProperty.setValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME, 'prop-value-ACME', ACME_DOMAIN_ID); gs.info('Value for ACME domain: ' + GlideApplicationProperty.getValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME, ACME_DOMAIN_ID)); } catch (ex) { gs.info('Exception: ' + ex); } // Override the value for Cisco domain -- assuming that the current session domain is Cisco. Notice that we don't pass domain-id explicitly session.setDomainID(CISCO_DOMAIN_ID); // NOTE: this API is not available from non-global scope (use domain-picker to switch to Cisco) gs.info('Domain: ' + session.getCurrentDomainID()); GlideApplicationProperty.setValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME, 'prop-value-Cisco'); gs.info('Value for current session (Cisco) domain: ' + GlideApplicationProperty.getValue(MY_APP_PROP_NAME));
children.text2:
This  shows how to create a new application property and override its value for ACME
        and Cisco domains.

children.name: name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the application property to save.
Note: If the application is not global, you must prefix the name of the sys_application_property with the application's scope.

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Value to store in the specified application property.

children.name: domainSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Sys_id of the domain associated with the application property.

Default: Current session domain

children.name: setValue(String name, String value, String domainSysId)
children.text:
Stores the specified value in the specified application property for the specified
    domain, or the current session domain if not specified.
children.text2:
The following are guidelines for using this method:

  • The application property is not created if its name contains one of the following strings:
    • glide.properties.blacklist
    • glide.properties.no_db_override
    • glide.properties.safe_overrides
    • glide.properties.maint_write_roles
  • The application property is not created if there is an existing system property with the same name, and the system property is marked as private.
  • The application property is not created if there is an existing system property and the application property does not reference it.
  • The name of the application property in the sys_application_property table is prefixed with the application's scope if it is not global.
  • This method cannot be called from a different scope.

name: GlideApplicationProperty - Scoped, Global
text: The GlideApplicationProperty API provides the ability to get and set application property values for a specific domain.
text2:
Application properties enable service providers to customize application functionality based on the domain. Instead of only having a single system property (System Property [sys_properties] table) that defines the functionality for all domains and users, application properties can be implemented to define functionality for specific domains.

To access this API you must activate the Domain Support - Domain Extensions Installer (com.glide.domain.msp_extensions.installer) plugin.

For additional information on domain-specific application properties, see Domain-separated application properties.

name: GlideCalendarDateTime
text: The GlideCalendarDateTime class provides methods for performing operations on GlideCalendarDateTime objects, such as instantiating GlideCalendarDateTime objects or working with glide_date_time fields.
text2: This API has been deprecated. Please use the GlideDateTime API instead.

children.name: Example
children.text: //Today's date is April 21, 2021 var gd = new GlideDate(); gs.info(gd.getValue());

children.name: GlideDate()
children.text: Creates a GlideDate object with the current date time.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gd = new GlideDate(); gd.setValue('2021-04-21'); gs.info(gd.getByFormat("dd-MM-yyyy"));

children.name: String
children.text: Date value for the GlideDate object in the specified format.

children.name: format
children.text: String
children.text2: Desired date format using Java SimpleDateFormat. For example, "dd-MM-yyyy" to get the day, month, and year, or "EEEE" to get the day of the week.

children.name: getByFormat(String format)
children.text: Gets the date in the specified date format.

children.name: Example
children.text: //Today's date is 2016-05-13 var gd =new GlideDate(); gs.info(gd.getDayOfMonthNoTZ());

children.name: Number
children.text: The day of the month in the UTC time zone, from 1 to 31.

children.name: getDayOfMonthNoTZ()
children.text:
Gets the day of the month stored by the GlideDate object, expressed in the UTC time
    zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gd = new GlideDate(); gd.setValue('2021-04-21'); gs.info(gd.getDisplayValue());

children.name: String
children.text:
Date value for the GlideDate object in the current user's display format and
                time zone. Keep in mind when designing business rules or script includes that this
                method may return values in different formats for different users.

children.name: getDisplayValue()
children.text: Gets the date in the current user's display format and time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gd = new GlideDate(); gs.info(gd.getDisplayValueInternal());

children.name: String
children.text:
Date value for the GlideDate object in the current user's time zone.

Format: yyyy-MM-dd

children.name: getDisplayValueInternal()
children.text: Gets the date in the internal format (yyyy-MM-dd) and current user's timezone.

children.name: Example
children.text: //Today's date is 2016-05-13 var gd =new GlideDate(); gs.info(gd.getMonthNoTZ());

children.name: Number
children.text: The numerical value of the month from 1 to 12.

children.name: getMonthNoTZ()
children.text: Gets the month stored by the GlideDate object, expressed in the UTC time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gd = new GlideDate(); gd.setValue('2021-04-21'); gs.info(gd.getValue());

children.name: String
children.text:
The date value for the GlideDate object in the system time zone.

Format: yyyy-MM-dd

children.name: getValue()
children.text:
Gets the date in the internal format (yyyy-MM-dd) and the system time zone (UTC by
    default).

children.name: Example
children.text: //Today's date is 2016-05-13 var gd =new GlideDate(); gs.info(gd.getYearNoTZ());

children.name: Number
children.text: The numerical value of the year.

children.name: getYearNoTZ()
children.text: Gets the year stored by the GlideDate object, expressed in the UTC time zone.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: asDisplayed
children.text: String
children.text2:
Date in the current user's display format and time zone.

Format: Must be formatted using the current user's preferred display format, such as yyyy-MM-dd.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gd = new GlideDate(); gd.setDisplayValue("2011-01-01"); gs.info(gd.getValue());

children.name: setDisplayValue(String asDisplayed)
children.text: Sets a date value using the current user's display format and time zone.

children.name: o
children.text: String
children.text2:
Date and time to set in the current GlideDate object.

Format: yyyy-MM-dd

children.name: Example
children.text: var gd = new GlideDate(); gd.setValue('2015-01-01'); gs.info(gd.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setValue(String o)
children.text:
Sets the date of the current GlideDate object in internal format (yyyy-MM-dd) and the
    system time zone (UTC by default).

children.name: Output
children.text: 1 Day

children.name: Example
children.text: var sgd1 = new GlideDate(); sgd1.setDisplayValue('2014-07-18'); var sgd2 = new GlideDate(); sgd2.setDisplayValue('2014-07-19'); var duration = GlideDate.subtract(sgd1, sgd2); gs.info(duration.getDisplayValue());

children.name: GlideDuration
children.text: The duration between the two values.

children.name: start
children.text: GlideDate
children.text2: The start value.

children.name: end
children.text: GlideDate
children.text2: The end value.

children.name: subtract(GlideDate start, GlideDate end)
children.text: Gets the duration difference between two GlideDate values.

name: GlideDate
text: The scoped GlideDate class provides methods for performing operations on GlideDate objects, such as instantiating GlideDate objects or working with GlideDate fields.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime();

children.name: GlideDateTime()
children.text:
Instantiates a new GlideDateTime object with the current date and time in Greenwich
    Mean Time (GMT).

children.name: g
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: The GlideDateTime object to use for setting the time of the new object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var start = new GlideDateTime("2011-01-01 12:00:00"); var end = new GlideDateTime(start); gs.info(end);

children.name: GlideDateTime(GlideDateTime g)
children.text:
Instantiates a new GlideDateTime object set to the time of the GlideDateTime object
    passed in the parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-01-01 12:00:00");

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: A UTC date and time using the internal format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.

children.name: GlideDateTime(String value)
children.text:
Instantiates a new GlideDateTime object from a date and time value in the UTC time zone
    specified with the format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); var gtime1 = new GlideTime(); gtime1.setValue("00:00:20"); gdt.add(gtime1); var gtime2 = gdt.getTime(); gs.info(gtime2.getByFormat('hh:mm:ss'));

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: gd
children.text: GlideTime
children.text2:
GlideTime object whose time value to add to the specified GlideDateTime
                object.

children.name: add(GlideTime gd)
children.text: Adds a GlideTime object to the current GlideDateTime object.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: milliseconds
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of milliseconds to add.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getNumericValue()); gdt.add(10); gs.info(gdt.getNumericValue());

children.name: add(Number milliseconds)
children.text: Adds the specified number of milliseconds to the current GlideDateTime object.

children.name: days
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of days to add. Use a negative value to subtract.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addDaysLocalTime(-1); gs.info(gdt.getLocalDate());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: addDaysLocalTime(Number days)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of days to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts days. The method determines the local date and time equivalent to the value
    stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts days using the local date and time
    values.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addDaysUTC(-1); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: days
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of days to add. Use a negative number to subtract.

children.name: addDaysUTC(Number days)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of days to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts days. The method determines the UTC date and time equivalent to the value
    stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts days using the UTC date and time
    values.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: months
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of months to add. use a negative value to subtract.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addMonthsLocalTime(2); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: addMonthsLocalTime(Number months)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of months to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts months. The method determines the local date and time equivalent to the
    value stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts months using the local date and
    time values.

children.name: months
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of months to add. Use a negative value to subtract.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addMonthsUTC(2); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: addMonthsUTC(Number months)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of months to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts months. The method determines the UTC date and time equivalent to the value
    stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts months using the UTC date and time
    values.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-07 08:00:00"); gdt.addSeconds(1000); gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: seconds
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of seconds to add.

children.name: addSeconds(Number seconds)
children.text: Adds the specified number of seconds to the current GlideDateTime object.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addWeeksLocalTime(-1); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: addWeeksLocalTime(Number weeks)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of weeks to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts weeks. The method determines the local date and time equivalent to the value
    stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts weeks using the local date and time
    values.

children.name: weeks
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of weeks to add. Use a negative value to subtract.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addWeeksUTC(-1); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: addWeeksUTC(Number weeks)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of weeks to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts weeks. The method determines the UTC date and time equivalent to the value
    stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts weeks using the UTC date and time
