children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2010-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addYearsLocalTime(1); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: years
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of years to add.  Use a negative value to subtract.

children.name: addYearsLocalTime(Number years)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of years to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts years. The method determines the local date and time equivalent to the value
    stored by the GlideDateTime object, then adds or subtracts years using the local date and time
    values.

children.name: years
children.text: Number
children.text2: The number of years to add. Use a negative value to subtract.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2010-08-31 08:00:00"); gdt.addYearsUTC(1); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: addYearsUTC(Number years)
children.text:
Adds a specified number of years to the current GlideDateTime object. A negative
    parameter subtracts years. The date and time value stored by GlideDateTime object is interpreted
    as being in the UTC time zone.

children.name: Output
children.text2: False

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt1 = new GlideDateTime("2016-05-09 10:11:12"); var gdt2 = new GlideDateTime("2017-06-12 15:11:12"); gs.info(gdt1.after(gdt2));

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the GlideDateTime object's date and time is after the date and time specified by the parameter.
Possible values:
  • true: GlideDateTime object date and time is after the specified object's date and time.
  • false: GlideDateTime object date and time is before or equal to the specified object's date and time.

children.name: gdt
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: Date and time to check against.

children.name: after(GlideDateTime gdt)
children.text:
Determines if the GlideDateTime object's date and time occurs after the specified
    object's date and time.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt1 = new GlideDateTime("2016-05-09 10:11:12"); var gdt2 = new GlideDateTime("2017-06-12 15:11:12"); gs.info(gdt1.before(gdt2));

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the GlideDateTime object's date and time is before the date and time specified by the parameter.
Possible values:
  • true: GlideDateTime object date and time is before the specified date and time.
  • false: GlideDateTime object date and time is after or equal to the specified date and time.

children.name: gdt
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: Date and time to check against.

children.name: before(GlideDateTime gdt)
children.text:
Determines if the GlideDateTime object's date and time occurs before the specified
    GlideDateTime object's date and time.

children.name: Number
children.text:
• 0 = Dates are equal
  • 1 = The object's date is after the date specified in the parameter
  • -1 = The object's date is before the date specified in the parameter

children.name: o
children.text: Object
children.text2: Date and time object in GlideDateTime format

children.name: Example
children.text: var initDate = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-01 12:00:00"); var compDate1 = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-01 12:00:00"); var compDate2 = new GlideDateTime("2011-07-31 12:00:00"); var compDate3 = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-04 16:00:00"); gs.info(initDate.compareTo(compDate1)); // Equals (0) gs.info(initDate.compareTo(compDate2)); // initDate is after compDate2 (1) gs.info(initDate.compareTo(compDate3)); // initDate is before compDate3 (-1)

children.name: compareTo(Object o)
children.text:
Compares two date and time objects to determine whether they are equivalent or one
    occurs before or after the other.

children.name: dateTime
children.text: GlideDateTime object or String
children.text2: The datetime to compare.

children.name: Output
children.text2: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 00:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.equals("2011-09-30 00:12:01"));

children.name: Boolean
children.text: Returns true if they are equal; otherwise, false.

children.name: equals(Object dateTime)
children.text: Compares a datetime with an existing value for equality.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getDate());

children.name: String
children.text: Date in the system time zone.

children.name: getDate()
children.text:
Returns the date stored by the GlideDateTime object. Expressed in the standard format,
    yyyy-MM-dd, and in the system time zone, GMT by default.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-02 12:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getDayOfMonthLocalTime());

children.name: Number
children.text: The day of the month in the user's time zone, from 1 to 31.

children.name: getDayOfMonthLocalTime()
children.text:
Gets the day of the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the current
    user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-02 12:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getDayOfMonthUTC());

children.name: Number
children.text: The day of the month in the UTC time zone, from 1 to 31.

children.name: getDayOfMonthUTC()
children.text:
Gets the day of the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the UTC time
    zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-01 12:00:00");//Thursday gs.info(gdt.getDayOfWeekLocalTime());

children.name: Number
children.text:
The day of week value, in the user's time zone, from 1 to 7. Monday equals 1,
                Sunday equals 7.

children.name: getDayOfWeekLocalTime()
children.text:
Gets the day of the week stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the user's
    time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-01 12:00:00");//Thursday gs.info(gdt.getDayOfWeekLocalTime());

children.name: Number
children.text: The day of week value from 1 to 7. Monday equals 1, Sunday equals 7.

children.name: getDayOfWeekUTC()
children.text:
Gets the day of the week stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the UTC time
    zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-02 12:00:00"); //December gs.info(gdt.getDaysInMonthLocalTime());

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of days in the current month in the user's time zone.

children.name: getDaysInMonthLocalTime()
children.text:
Gets the number of days in the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in
    the current user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-11-02 12:00:00"); //November gs.info(gdt.getDaysInMonthUTC());

children.name: Number
children.text:
The number of days in the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed
                in the UTC time zone.

children.name: getDaysInMonthUTC()
children.text:
Gets the number of days in the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in
    the UTC time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getDisplayValue()); //uses current user session time zone (US/Pacific)

children.name: String
children.text:
The date and time in the user's format and time zone. Keep in mind
                when designing business rules or script includes that this method may return values
                in different formats for different users.

children.name: getDisplayValue()
children.text:
Gets the date and time value in the current user's display format and time
    zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getDisplayValueInternal()); //uses current user session time zone (US/Pacific)

children.name: String
children.text: The date and time values for the GlideDateTime object in the current user's time zone and the internal date and time format of yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.

children.name: getDisplayValueInternal()
children.text: Gets the display value in the internal format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getDSTOffset()); //uses current user session time zone (US/Pacific)

children.name: Number
children.text:
Amount of time, in milliseconds, that daylight saving is offset. Returns 0 if
                there is no offset or if the time is not during daylight saving time.

children.name: getDSTOffset()
children.text: Gets the amount of time that daylight saving time is offset.

children.name: Output
children.text2: Could not parse DateTime: 2011-aa-01 00:00:00

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setDisplayValue("2011-aa-01 00:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getErrorMsg());

children.name: String
children.text: The error message.

children.name: getErrorMsg()
children.text: Gets the current error message.

children.name: String
children.text: The object's time in the local time zone and the internal format.

children.name: getInternalFormattedLocalTime()
children.text:
Returns the object's time in the local time zone and in the internal
    format.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getLocalDate());

children.name: GlideDate
children.text: The date in the user's time zone.

children.name: getLocalDate()
children.text:
Gets the date stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the standard format,
    yyyy-MM-dd, and the current user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-08-31 08:00:00"); gt = gdt.getLocalTime(); gs.info("local time is " + gt.getByFormat('hh:mm:ss'));

children.name: GlideTime
children.text: The time in the user's time zone.

children.name: getLocalTime()
children.text:
Returns a GlideTime object that represents the time portion of the GlideDateTime object
    in the user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-11-02 12:00:00"); //November gs.info(gdt.getMonthLocalTime());

children.name: Number
children.text: The numerical value of the month.

children.name: getMonthLocalTime()
children.text:
Gets the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the current user's time
    zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-11-02 12:00:00"); //November gs.info(gdt.getMonthUTC());

children.name: Number
children.text: The numerical value of the month.

children.name: getMonthUTC()
children.text: Gets the month stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the UTC time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getNumericValue());

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

children.name: getNumericValue()
children.text: Gets the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-08-31 08:00:00"); gt = gdt.getTime(); gs.info(gt.getByFormat('hh:mm:ss'));

children.name: GlideTime
children.text: The Unix duration stamp in system format based on GMT time.

children.name: getTime()
children.text:
Returns a GlideTime object that represents the time portion of the GlideDateTime
    object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.getLocalTime(); // PST local time gs.info(gdt.getTZOffset());

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of milliseconds of time zone offset.

children.name: getTZOffset()
children.text: Gets the time zone offset in milliseconds.

children.name: String
children.text: The object's time in the local time zone and in the user's format.

children.name: getUserFormattedLocalTime()
children.text: Returns the object's time in the local time zone and in the user's format.

children.name: String
children.text: The date and time value in the internal format and system time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: getValue()
children.text:
Gets the date and time value stored by the GlideDateTime object in the internal format,
    yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss, and the system time zone, UTC by default.

children.name: Number
children.text:
The number of the current week in local time. The highest week number
                in a year is either 52 or 53.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-01 12:00:00");//49th week, 1st week in december gs.info(gdt.getWeekOfYearLocalTime());

children.name: getWeekOfYearLocalTime()
children.text:
Gets the number of the week stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the
    current user's time zone. All weeks begin on Sunday. The first week of the year is the week that
    contains at least one day of the new year. The week beginning Sunday 2015-12-27 is considered
    the first week of 2016 as that week contains January 1 and 2.

children.name: Number
children.text:
The number of the current week in UTC time. The highest week number in
                a year is either 52 or 53.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-01 12:00:00");//49th week, 1st week in december gs.info(gdt.getWeekOfYearUTC());

children.name: getWeekOfYearUTC()
children.text:
Gets the number of the week stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the UTC
    time zone. All weeks begin on Sunday. The first week of the year is the week that contains at
    least one day of the new year. The week beginning Sunday 2015-12-27 is considered the first week
    of 2016 as that week contains January 1 and 2.

children.name: Number
children.text: Four-digit year value in the user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-11-02 12:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getYearLocalTime());

children.name: getYearLocalTime()
children.text:
Gets the year stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the current user's time
    zone.

children.name: Number
children.text: 4-digit year value in the UTC time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-11-02 12:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.getYearUTC());

children.name: getYearUTC()
children.text: Gets the year stored by the GlideDateTime object, expressed in the UTC time zone.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the object date is set; otherwise, returns false.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.hasDate());

children.name: hasDate()
children.text: Determines if an object's date is set.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the time is daylight saving; otherwise, returns false.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-08-31 00:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.isDST()); //true

children.name: isDST()
children.text: Determines if an object's time uses a daylight saving offset.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if value is valid; otherwise, returns false.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-aa-31 aa:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.isValid()); //true gs.info(gdt.getErrorMsg()); //reason

children.name: isValid()
children.text: Determines if a value is a valid date and time.

children.name: Output
children.text: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt1 = new GlideDateTime("2016-05-09 10:11:12"); var gdt2 = new GlideDateTime("2017-06-12 15:11:12"); gs.info(gdt1.onOrAfter(gdt2));

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the GlideDateTime object's date and time is on or after the date and time specified by the parameter.
Possible values:
  • true: GlideDateTime object date and time is on or after the specified object's date and time.
  • false: GlideDateTime object date and time is before the specified object's date and time.

children.name: gdt
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: Date and time to check against.

children.name: onOrAfter(GlideDateTime gdt)
children.text:
Determines if the GlideDateTime object's data and time occurs on or after the specified
    GlideDateTime object's date and time.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the GlideDateTime object's date and time is on or before the date and time specified by the parameter.
Possible values:
  • true: GlideDateTime object date and time is on or before the specified object's date and time.
  • false: GlideDateTime object date and time is after the specified object's date and time.

children.name: gdt
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: Date and time to check against.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt1 = new GlideDateTime("2016-05-09 10:11:12"); var gdt2 = new GlideDateTime("2017-06-12 15:11:12"); gs.info(gdt1.onOrBefore(gdt2));

children.name: onOrBefore(GlideDateTime gdt)
children.text:
Determines if the GlideDateTime object's data and time occurs on or before the
    specified GlideDateTime object's date and time.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setDayOfMonthLocalTime(9); gs.info(gdt.getDayOfMonthLocalTime());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: day
children.text: Number
children.text2:
The day of month to change to, from 1 to 31. If this value is greater than the
                maximum number of days in the month, the value is set to the last day of the month.

children.name: setDayOfMonthLocalTime(Number day)
children.text:
Sets the day of the month to a specified value in the current user's time
    zone.

children.name: day
children.text: Number
children.text2:
The day of month to change to, from 1 to 31. If this value is greater than the
                maximum number of days in the month, the value is set to the last day of the month.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setDayOfMonthUTC(9); gs.info(gdt.getDayOfMonthUTC());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setDayOfMonthUTC(Number day)
children.text: Sets the day of the month to a specified value in the UTC time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-02-02 12:00:00"); gdt.setDisplayValue("2014-01-01 12:00:00");//uses current user session time zone (US/Pacific) gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: asDisplayed
children.text: String
children.text2: The date and time in the current user's display format and time zone. The parameter must be formatted using the current user's preferred display format, such as MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm:ss. To assign the current date and time to a variable in a workflow script, use variable.setDisplayValue(gs.nowDateTime);.

children.name: setDisplayValue(String asDisplayed)
children.text:
Sets a date and time value using the current user's display format and time
    zone.

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Date and time in the current user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-02-02 12:00:00"); gdt.setDisplayValue("20-5-2011 12:00:00", "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss"); //uses current user session time zone gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: format
children.text: String
children.text2:
Date and time format to use to parse the value parameter.
Use the following values to describe the value parameter:
  • dd: Day of the month
  • MM: Month of the year
  • yyyy: Year
  • HH: Hour
  • mm: Minutes
  • ss: Seconds

For example: "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss" or "MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm".

children.name: setDisplayValue(String value, String format)
children.text:
Sets a date and time value using the current user's time zone and the specified date
    and time format.
children.text2: This method throws a runtime exception if the date and time format used in the value parameter does not match the format parameter. You can retrieve the error message by calling getErrorMsg() on the GlideDateTime object after the exception is caught.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2014-02-02 12:00:00"); gdt.setDisplayValueInternal("2014-01-01 12:00:00"); //uses current user session time zone (US/Pacific) gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: The date and time in internal format.

children.name: setDisplayValueInternal(String value)
children.text:
Sets a date and time value using the internal format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss) and the
    current user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dt1 = new GlideDateTime("2011-01-01 12:00:00"); var dt2 = new GlideDateTime("2011-02-02 08:00:00"); dt1.setGlideDateTime(dt2); gs.info(dt1.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: g
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: The object to use for setting the datetime value.

children.name: setGlideDateTime(GlideDateTime g)
children.text:
Sets the date and time of the current object using an existing GlideDateTime object.
    This method is equivalent to instantiating a new object with a GlideDateTime
    parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setMonthLocalTime(1); gs.info(gdt.getMonthLocalTime());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: month
children.text: Number
children.text2: The month to change to.

children.name: setMonthLocalTime(Number month)
children.text:
Sets the month stored by the GlideDateTime object to the specified value using the
    current user's time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setMonthUTC(1); gs.info(gdt.getMonthUTC());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: month
children.text: Number
children.text2: The month to change to.

children.name: setMonthUTC(Number month)
children.text:
Sets the month stored by the GlideDateTime object to the specified value using the UTC
    time zone.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: o
children.text: String
children.text2:
The date and time to use. This parameter may be one of several types:
  • A string in the UTC time zone and the internal format of yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss. Sets the value of the object to the specified date and time. Using the method this way is equivalent to instantiating a new GlideDateTime object using the GlideDateTime(String value) constructor. If the date and time format used does not match the internal format, the method attempts to set the date and time using other available formats. Resolving the date and time this way can lead to inaccurate data due to ambiguity in the day and month values. When using a non-standard date and time format, use setValueUTC(String dt, String format) instead.
  • A GlideDateTime object. Sets the value of the object to the date and time stored by the GlideDateTime passed in the parameter. Using the method this way is equivalent to instantiating a new GlideDateTime object using the GlideDateTime(GlideDateTime g) constructor.
  • A JavaScript Number. Sets the value of the object using the Number value as milliseconds past January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-01-01 12:00:00"); gdt.setValue("2011-02-02 08:00:00"); // value set = 2011-02-02 08:00:00 gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: setValue(String o)
children.text: Sets the date and time of the GlideDateTime object.

children.name: dt
children.text: String
children.text2: The date and time to use.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-01-01 12:00:00"); gdt.setValueUTC("15-02-2011 08:00:00", "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm:ss"); gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: format
children.text: String
children.text2: The date and time format to use.

children.name: setValueUTC(String dt, String format)
children.text: Sets a date and time value using the UTC time zone and the specified date and time format. This method throws a runtime exception if the date and time format used in the dt parameter does not match the format parameter. You can retrieve the error message by calling getErrorMsg() on the GlideDateTime object after the exception is caught.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setYearLocalTime(2013); gs.info(gdt.getYearLocalTime());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: year
children.text: Number
children.text2: The year to change to.

children.name: setYearLocalTime(Number year)
children.text:
Sets the year stored by the GlideDateTime object to the specified value using the
    current user's time zone.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: year
children.text: Number
children.text2: The year to change to.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime(); gdt.setYearUTC(2013); gs.info(gdt.getYearUTC());

children.name: setYearUTC(Number year)
children.text:
Sets the year stored by the GlideDateTime object to the specified value using the UTC
    time zone.

children.name: Start
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: Start date object.

children.name: Output
children.text: 2 Days 23 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt1 = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-28 09:00:00"); var gdt2 = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); var dur = GlideDateTime.subtract(gdt1, gdt2); //the difference between gdt1 and gdt2 gs.info(dur.getDisplayValue());

children.name: GlideDuration
children.text: Duration difference between the two specified dates.

children.name: End
children.text: GlideDateTime
children.text2: End date object.

children.name: subtract(GlideDateTime start, GlideDateTime end)
children.text:
Returns the duration difference between two specified GlideDateTime
    objects.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); var gtime1 = new GlideTime(); gtime1.setValue("00:00:20"); gdt.subtract(gtime1); var gtime2 = gdt.getTime(); gs.info(gtime2.getByFormat('hh:mm:ss'));

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: time
children.text: GlideTime
children.text2: The time value to subtract.

children.name: subtract(GlideTime time)
children.text: Subtracts a specified amount of time from the current GlideDateTime object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-12-07 08:00:00"); gdt.subtract(1000); gs.info(gdt.getValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: milliseconds
children.text: Number
children.text2: Number of milliseconds to subtract.

children.name: subtract(Number milliseconds)
children.text: Subtracts the specified number of milliseconds from the GlideDateTime object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gdt = new GlideDateTime("2011-08-31 08:00:00"); gs.info(gdt.toString());

children.name: String
children.text:
The date and time stored by the GlideDateTime object in the system time zone
                and format.

children.name: toString()
children.text:
Gets the date and time value stored by the GlideDateTime object in the internal format,
    yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss, and the system time zone, UTC by default. This method is equivalent to
    getValue().

name: GlideDateTime
text:
The scoped GlideDateTime class provides methods for performing operations on
    GlideDateTime objects, such as instantiating GlideDateTime objects or working with
    glide_date_time fields.
text2:
Use the GlideDateTime methods to perform date-time operations, such as instantiating a
      GlideDateTime object, performing date-time calculations, formatting a date-time, or converting
      between date-time formats.

children.name: Example
children.text: var builder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder();

children.name: GlideDBFunctionBuilder()
children.text: Instantiates a GlideDBFunctionBuilder object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.add(); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.field('order'); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.field('priority'); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: add()
children.text: Adds the values of two or more integer fields.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define fields on which the operation is performed.

children.name: Output
children.text: *** Script: glidefunction:add(order,priority)

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.add(); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.field('order'); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.field('priority'); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.build(); gs.info(myAddingFunction);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: build()
children.text: Builds the database function defined by the GlideDBFunctionBuilder object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myConcatFunction = functionBuilder.concat(); myConcatFunction = functionBuilder.field('short_description'); myConcatFunction = functionBuilder.field('caller_id.name'); myConcatFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: concat()
children.text: Concatenates the values of two or more fields.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define fields on which the operation is performed.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: constant
children.text: String
children.text2:
A constant value used in a function.

When used with the dayofweek() method, the value defines whether the week starts on a Sunday or Monday.

  • 1: Week begins on Sunday.
  • 2: Week begins on Monday.

This definition enables the dayofweek() method to return the correct day of the week from a given date. If a value other than 1 or 2 is provided, the dayofweek() method uses Sunday as the first day of the week.

children.name: constant(String constant)
children.text: Defines a constant value to use in the function. If used with the dayofweek() method, the string defines whether to use Sunday or Monday as the first day of the week.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myDateDiffFunction = functionBuilder.datediff(); myDateDiffFunction = functionBuilder.field('sys_updated_on'); myDateDiffFunction = functionBuilder.field('opened_at'); myDateDiffFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: datediff()
children.text: Determines the duration using a given start date/time and end date/time.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define start and end date/time fields.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var dayOfWeekFunction = functionBuilder.dayofweek(); dayOfWeekFunction = functionBuilder.field('opened_at'); dayOfWeekFunction = functionBuilder.constant('2'); dayOfWeekFunction = functionBuilder.build(); var now_GR = new GlideRecord('incident'); now_GR.addFunction(dayOfWeekFunction); now_GR.query(); while(now_GR.next()) gs.log(now_GR.getValue(dayOfWeekFunction));

children.name: Integer
children.text:
If the first day of the week is set to Sunday in the constant(String constant) method, return values are associated with the following days of the week:

  • 1: Sunday
  • 2: Monday
  • 3: Tuesday
  • 4: Wednesday
  • 5: Thursday
  • 6: Friday
  • 7: Saturday

If the first day of the week is set to Monday:

  • 1: Monday
  • 2: Tuesday
  • 3: Wednesday
  • 4: Thursday
  • 5: Friday
  • 6: Saturday
  • 7: Sunday

If a value other than 1 or 2 is provided in the constant(String constant) method, the dayofweek() method uses Sunday as the first day of the week.

children.name: dayofweek()
children.text: Returns an integer representing the day of the week for a given date.
children.text2:
Use the field(String field) method to define the given date/time. Use the constant(String constant) method to define whether the week starts on a Sunday or Monday.

This method can be used with MySQL, Oracle, and Microsoft SQL Server databases only. If using an Oracle database, the NLS_TERRITORY setting must be set to a territory with Sunday as the first day of the week.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myDivideFunction = functionBuilder.divide(); myDivideFunction = functionBuilder.field('order'); myDivideFunction = functionBuilder.field('priority'); myDivideFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: divide()
children.text: Divides the value of one integer field by another.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define fields on which the operation is performed.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.add(); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.field('order'); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.field('priority'); myAddingFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: field
children.text: String
children.text2: The field on which you are performing the SQL operation.

children.name: field(String field)
children.text: Defines a field on which a SQL operation is performed.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myLengthFunction = functionBuilder.length(); myLengthFunction = functionBuilder.field('short_description'); myLengthFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: length()
children.text: Determines the number of code units in a field.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define fields on which the operation is performed.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var myMultiplyFunction = functionBuilder.multiply(); myMultiplyFunction = functionBuilder.field('order'); myMultiplyFunction = functionBuilder.field('priority'); myMultiplyFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: multiply()
children.text: Multiplies the values of two integer fields.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define fields on which the operation is performed.

children.name: Example
children.text: var functionBuilder = new GlideDBFunctionBuilder(); var mySubtractFunction = functionBuilder.subtract(); mySubtractFunction = functionBuilder.field('order'); mySubtractFunction = functionBuilder.field('priority'); mySubtractFunction = functionBuilder.build();

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: subtract()
children.text: Subtracts the value of one integer field from another.
children.text2: Use the field(String field) method to define fields on which the operation is performed.

name: GlideDBFunctionBuilder - Scoped, Global
text: Build functions to perform SQL operations in the database.
text2:
The GlideDBFunctionBuilder methods provide a way to build Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) functions to perform SQL operations on record data. These methods can be used in both scoped and global server scripts.

To use platform functions:
  • Construct a function using the GlideDBFunctionBuilder constructor and associated methods.
  • After building a function, you can apply the function to the current record using the addFunction() method of the GlideRecord class.
  • Add the function to a query using the addQuery() method of the GlideRecord class.
  • Retrieve the results of the function using the existing GlideRecord API methods such as getValue() and getElement().

name: GlideDigest
text:
The scoped GlideDigest class provides methods for creating a message digest from strings
  or input streams using MD5, SHA1, or SHA256 hash algorithms.

children.name: GlideDuration()
children.text: Instantiates a GlideDuration object.

children.name: Output
children.text: 3 Days 12 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var duration = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); var duration2 = new GlideDuration(duration); gs.info(duration2.getDisplayValue());

children.name: another
children.text: GlideDuration
children.text2: GlideDuration object.

children.name: GlideDuration(GlideDuration another)
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideDuration object by cloning the values of the passed in
    GlideDuration object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration(60000); gs.info(dur.getDurationValue());

children.name: milliseconds
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Duration value.

Unit: Milliseconds

children.name: GlideDuration(Number milliseconds)
children.text: Instantiates a GlideDuration object with the specified duration in milliseconds.

children.name: Output
children.text: 3 Days 15 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var duration = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); var duration2 = new GlideDuration('3:00:00'); var answer = duration.add(duration2); gs.info(answer.getDisplayValue());

children.name: displayValue
children.text: String
children.text2:
Duration value.

Format: d HH:mm:ss where "d" is number of days.

children.name: GlideDuration(String displayValue)
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideDuration object with the specified duration display
    value.

children.name: GlideDuration
children.text:
New GlideDuration object whose duration is the sum of the durations of the two
                GlideDuration objects.

children.name: duration
children.text: GlideDuration
children.text2:
GlideDuration object that contains the duration value to add to the current
                GlideDuration object.

children.name: Output
children.text: 3 Days 15 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var duration = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); var duration2 = new GlideDuration('3:00:00'); var answer = duration.add(duration2); gs.info(answer.getDisplayValue());

children.name: add(GlideDuration duration)
children.text:
Adds the duration of the specified GlideDuration object to the current GlideDuration
    object.

children.name: String
children.text: Current duration in the specified format.

children.name: format
children.text: String
children.text2:
Duration format.

Format: Global date and time field format

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration('3 22:00:00'); gs.info(dur.getByFormat('HH:mm'));

children.name: getByFormat(String format)
children.text: Returns the duration value in the specified format.

children.name: Number
children.text: Number of days in the duration.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); gs.info(dur.getDayPart());

children.name: getDayPart()
children.text: Returns the number of days.

children.name: Output
children.text: 3 Days 12 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); gs.info(dur.getDisplayValue());

children.name: String
children.text:
Number of days, hours, and minutes, such as 2 Days 10 Hours 36 Minutes.

Format: Display value: "n" Days "n" Hours "n" Minutes

children.name: getDisplayValue()
children.text:
Returns the display value of the duration in number of days, hours, and
    minutes.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration(60000); gs.info(dur.getDurationValue());

children.name: String
children.text:
Duration value.

Format: d HH:mm:ss where "d" is number of days.

children.name: getDurationValue()
children.text: Returns the duration value in "d HH:mm:ss" format.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration('3 14:00:00'); gs.info(dur.getRoundedDayPart());

children.name: Number
children.text: Day value of the display value rounded.

children.name: getRoundedDayPart()
children.text:
Returns the rounded number of days. If the time part is more than 12 hours, the return
    value is rounded up. Otherwise, it is rounded down.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); gs.info(dur.getValue());

children.name: String
children.text:
Current duration within the GlideDuration object.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss

children.name: getValue()
children.text: Returns the internal date/time value of the current GlideDuration object.
children.text2: GlideDuration objects store the duration as a date and time from January 1, 1970, 00:00:00.

children.name: Output
children.text: 3 Days 8 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration(); dur.setDisplayValue('3 08:00:00'); gs.info(dur.getDisplayValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: asDisplayed
children.text: String
children.text2:
Display duration value to set.

Format: d HH:mm:ss where "d" is number of days

children.name: setDisplayValue(String asDisplayed)
children.text: Sets the duration display value.

children.name: Output
children.text: 4 Days 8 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var dur = new GlideDuration(); dur.setValue('1970-01-05 08:00:00'); // sets internal DateTime value. The String is parsed into a GlideDateTime object. gs.info(dur.getDisplayValue());

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: o
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Date and time to use as the endpoint for the calculated duration time.

Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss

children.name: setValue(Object o)
children.text: Sets the internal date/time value of the GlideDuration object.
children.text2: The method sets the duration value to the difference of the passed in date/time the base date/time value of January 1, 1970, 00:00:00. The passed in date/time object (string) is parsed into a GlideDateTime object.

children.name: GlideDuration
children.text:
New GlideDuration object whose duration contains the result of the subtraction
                of the duration of the two GlideDuration objects.

children.name: duration
children.text: GlideDuration
children.text2:
GlideDuration object that contains the duration value to subtract from the
                current GlideDuration object.

children.name: Output
children.text: 3 Days 9 Hours

children.name: Example
children.text: var duration = new GlideDuration('3 12:00:00'); var duration2 = new GlideDuration('3:00:00'); var answer = duration.subtract(duration2); gs.info(answer.getDisplayValue());

children.name: subtract(GlideDuration duration)
children.text:
Subtracts the duration of the specified GlideDuration object to the current
    GlideDuration object.

name: GlideDuration
text: The GlideDuration class provides methods for working with spans of time known as durations.
text2: GlideDuration objects store the duration as the number of days and time from January 1, 1970, 00:00:00. As a result, setValue() and getValue() use the scoped GlideDateTime object for parameters and return values.

children.name: Scoped equivalent
children.text: To use the canCreate() method in a scoped application, use the corresponding scoped method: canCreate().

children.name: Output
children.text:
I can create new records for the field Problem statement for - PRB0000004
I can create new records for the field Problem statement for - PRB0001000
I can create new records for the field Problem statement for - PRB0001001

children.name: Example
children.text: var gr = new GlideRecord('problem'); // Get records in new state in Problem Table gr.addQuery('state','101'); // Sort records in order of recent to earlier Created Date gr.orderByDesc('sys_created_on'); // Limit the query to three records gr.setLimit(3); gr.query(); while(gr.next()){ if(gr.short_description.canCreate()){ ///check to see if the current user is allowed to create the record gs.info("I can create new records for the field Problem statement for - " + gr.number); } }
children.text2:
The following  shows how to determine if the user has permissions to create entries
        for the three most recent records in the Problem [problem] table.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the current user has permissions to create new entries in the associated field.
Possible values:
  • true: User can create new entries.
  • false: User cannot create new entries.

children.name: canCreate()
children.scopedEquivalentBlock: To use the canCreate() method in a scoped application, use the corresponding scoped method: canCreate().
children.text:
Determines if the user's role permits the creation of new entries in the associated
    field.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: You have permission to read the short description of: INC0009009 Unable to access the shared folder.
*** Script: You have permission to read the short description of: INC0009005 Email server is down.
*** Script: You have permission to read the short description of: INC0009001 Unable to post content on a Wiki page

children.name: Example
children.text: var grIncident = new GlideRecord('incident'); grIncident.addEncodedQuery("active=true"); //Query the Incident table for active incidents grIncident.orderByDesc('number'); grIncident.setLimit(3); // limit to three results for example grIncident.query(); while (grIncident.next()) { if (grIncident.short_description.canRead()) { //check to see if the current user is allowed to read the record gs.info('You have permission to read the short description of: ' + grIncident.number + ' ' + grIncident.short_description); } }
children.text2:
The following  shows how to get a list of active Incident records with a readable
        Short Description field.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the field can be read, false otherwise.

children.name: canRead()
children.text:
Indicates whether the user's role permits them to read the associated
    GlideRecord.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: You have permission to write to the short description of: INC0009009 Unable to access the shared folder.
*** Script: You have permission to write to the short description of: INC0009005 Email server is down.
*** Script: You have permission to write to the short description of: INC0009001 Unable to post content on a Wiki page

children.name: Example
children.text: var grIncident = new GlideRecord('incident'); grIncident.addEncodedQuery("active=true"); //Query the Incident table for active incidents grIncident.orderByDesc('number'); grIncident.setLimit(3); // limit to three results for example grIncident.query(); while (grIncident.next()) { if (grIncident.short_description.canWrite()) { //check to see if the current user is allowed to write to the record gs.info('You have permission to write to the short description of: ' + grIncident.number + ' ' + grIncident.short_description); } }
children.text2:
The following  shows how to get a list of active Incident records with a writeable
        Short Description field.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the user can write to the field, false otherwise.

children.name: canWrite()
children.text:
Determines whether the user's role permits them to write to the associated
    GlideRecord.

children.name: Example
children.text: if (!current.assigned_to.nil() && current.assigned_to.changes()) { gs.eventQueue('incident.assigned', current, current.assigned_to.getDisplayValue(), previous.assigned_to.getDisplayValue()); }
children.text2: The following from a business rule shows how to create an event in the EventQueue if the value of the assigned_to field changes.

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the fields have been changed, false if the field has not.

children.name: changes()
children.text:
Determines if the current field has been modified. This functionality is available for
    all available data types, except Journal fields.
children.text2:
Note: The changes() method is not supported within ACL scripts.

Note: If the GlideRecord on which you are performing this method has only been initialized and read, and has not been written, the underlying before-and-after values are the same. In this case, the method returns "false", as there has been no change to the data store.

children.name: Example
children.text: // The following example shows that in a business rule, if "active" field is changed from true, // insert a event in the EventQueue. if (current.active.changesFrom(true)) { gs.eventQueue("incident.inactive", current, current.incident_state, previous.incident_state); }

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the previous value matches, false if it does not.

children.name: o
children.text: Object
children.text2:
An object value to check against the previous value of the current
                field.

children.name: changesFrom(Object o)
children.text:
Determines if the previous value of the current field matches the specified
    object.
children.text2: Note: If the GlideRecord on which you are performing this method has only been initialized and read, and has not been written, the underlying before-and-after values are the same. In this case, the method returns "false", as there has been no change to the data store.

children.name: Example
children.text: // The following example shows that in a business rule, if "active" field is changed to false, // insert a event in the EventQueue. if (current.active.changesTo(false)) { gs.eventQueue("incident.inactive", current, current.incident_state, previous.incident_state); }

children.name: Boolean
children.text: True if the previous value matches, false if it does not.

children.name: o
children.text: Object
children.text2: An object value to check against the new value of the current field.

children.name: changesTo(Object o)
children.text:
Determines if the new value of a field, after a change, matches the specified
    object.
children.text2:
Note: The changesTo() method is not supported within ACL scripts.

Note: If the GlideRecord on which you are performing this method has only been initialized and read, and has not been written, the underlying before-and-after values are the same. In this case, the method returns "false", as there has been no change to the data store.

children.name: Example
children.text: var inc = new GlideRecord('incident'); inc.get('17c90efb13418700cc36b1422244b05d'); gs.info(inc.calendar_duration.dateNumericValue());

children.name: Number
children.text: Number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

children.name: dateNumericValue()
children.text:
Returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT for a duration
    field. Does not require the creation of a GlideDateTime object because the duration field is
    already a GlideDateTime object.

children.name: attributeName
children.text: String
children.text2: Attribute name

children.name: Example
children.text: doit(); function doit() { var now_GR = new GlideRecord('sys_user'); now_GR.query("user_name","admin"); if (now_GR.next()) { gs.info("we got one"); gs.info(now_GR.location.getAttribute("tree_picker")); } }

children.name: String
children.text: Attribute value

children.name: getAttribute(String attributeName)
children.text: Returns the value of the specified attribute from the dictionary.
children.text2: If the attribute is a boolean attribute, use getBooleanAttribute(String) to get the value as a boolean rather than as a string.

children.name: Output
children.text:
true
false

children.name: Example
children.text: var inc = new GlideRecord('incident'); inc.query(); if (inc.next()) { // opened_by field has attribute "ignore_filter_on_new = true" gs.info(inc.opened_by.getBooleanAttribute("ignore_filter_on_new")); // short_description field does not have attribute ignore_filter_on_new gs.info(inc.short_description.getBooleanAttribute("ignore_filter_on_new")); }
children.text2: The following shows how to get Boolean values of the ignore_filter_on_new attribute for two fields.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Boolean value of the attribute. Returns false if the attribute does not
                exist.

children.name: attributeName
children.text: String
children.text2: Attribute name

children.name: getBooleanAttribute(String attributeName)
children.text: Returns the Boolean value of the specified attribute from the dictionary.
children.text2: To get the value as a string, use getAttribute(string).

children.name: dependent
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Field within the associated record on which the choice list field
                depends.

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); // urgency has choice list: 1 - High, 2 - Medium, 3 - Low, with value: 1, 2, 3 var choices = glideRecord.urgency.getChoices();

children.name: Array
children.text: List of possible values for the choice list, which are the values in the Choice [sys_choice] table. If the dependent parameter is passed, the return results reflect only those choices available for the specified dependent field.

children.name: getChoices(String dependent)
children.text: Returns the choice list for a specified field.
children.text2: The field for which to return the choice list is specified in the method call. For example: var choices = glideRecord.urgency.getChoices();. For information on choice list field types and their associated capabilities, see Choice list field type.

children.name: Output
children.text: 1 - High

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next();   // urgency has choice list: 1 - High, 2 - Medium, 3 - Low, with value: 1, 2, 3 var choiceLabel = glideRecord.urgency.getChoiceValue(); gs.info(choiceLabel);

children.name: String
children.text: The selected choice's label.

children.name: getChoiceValue()
children.text: Returns the choice label for the current choice.
children.text2: A choice has a value (number) and a label (string). This method returns the label.

children.name: Output
children.text: x_scoped_app: cleartextpassword

children.name: Example
children.text: var tablename = 'x_scoped_app_table' var CI = new GlideRecord(tablename); CI.addQuery('number', '0001002'); CI.query(); CI.next(); var password = CI.password_field var decrypted = password.getDecryptedValue(); gs.info(decrypted);

children.name: String
children.text: The clear text password.

children.name: getDecryptedValue()
children.text:
Returns the clear text value for Password (2 way encrypted) fields in scoped
    applications.

children.name: String
children.text: Display value of the specified field.

children.name: maxCharacters
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Optional. Maximum characters desired.

Default: All

children.name: Output
children.text: 1 - Critical

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); gs.info(glideRecord.priority.getDisplayValue());

children.name: getDisplayValue(Number maxCharacters)
children.text: Returns the formatted display value of the field.
children.text2:
Display values are manipulated based on the actual value in the database and user or system settings and preferences.

The display value that is returned is dependent on the field type.

  • Choice fields: The database value may be a number, but the display value will be more descriptive.
  • Date fields: The database value is in UTC format, while the display value is based on the user's time zone.
  • Encrypted text: The database value is encrypted, while the displayed value is unencrypted based on the user's encryption context.
  • Reference fields: The database value is sys_id, but the display value is a display field of the referenced record.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grInc = new GlideRecord('incident'); grInc.query('priority', '1'); var field = grInc.getElement('priority'); var ed = field.getED();

children.name: GlideElementDescriptor
children.text: The field's element descriptor.

children.name: getED()
children.text: Returns the field's element descriptor.

children.name: Example
children.text: // Passing walkup location name and closed phone number in parameters setWalkupLocPhone('Santa Clara Tech Lounge','phone_number'); function setWalkupLocPhone(locName, field) { var walkupLoc = new GlideRecord('wu_location_queue'); walkupLoc.addQuery('name',locName); walkupLoc.query(); walkupLoc.next(); // Returns the phone number of walk-up location queue in international format gs.info(walkupLoc[field].getGlobalDisplayValue()); }
children.text2: The following shows how to get the phone number of a walk-up location. This example requires the Walk-up Experience plugin.

children.name: String
children.text: Phone number in international format.

children.name: getGlobalDisplayValue()
children.text: Returns the phone number in international format.

children.name: Example
children.text: var inccause = new GlideRecord("incident"); inccause.short_description = current.short_description; inccause.comments = current.comments.getHTMLValue(); inccause.insert();

children.name: String
children.text: HTML value for the field.

children.name: maxChars
children.text: Number
children.text2: Optional. Maximum number of characters to return.

children.name: getHTMLValue(Number maxChars)
children.text: Returns the HTML value of a field.

children.name: String
children.text:
For the most recent entry, returns a string that contains the field label, timestamp, and user display name of the journal entry.

For all journal entries, returns the same information for all journal entries ever entered as a single string with each entry delimited by "\n\n".

children.name: mostRecent
children.text: Number
children.text2:
If 1, returns the most recent entry. If -1, returns all journal
                entries.

children.name: Example
children.text: //gets all journal entries as a string where each entry is delimited by '\n\n' var notes = current.work_notes.getJournalEntry(-1); //stores each entry into an array of strings var na = notes.split("\n\n"); for (var i = 0; i < na.length; i++) gs.info(na[i]);

children.name: getJournalEntry(Number mostRecent)
children.text: Returns either the most recent journal entry or all journal entries.

children.name: String
children.text: Object label

children.name: Example
children.text: var now_GR = new GlideRecord("sc_req_item"); now_GR.addQuery("request", current.sysapproval); now_GR.query(); while(now_GR.next()) { var nicePrice = now_GR.price.toString(); if (nicePrice != ) { nicePrice = parseFloat(nicePrice); nicePrice = nicePrice.toFixed(2); } template.print(now_GR.number + ": " + now_GR.quantity + " X " + now_GR.cat_item.getDisplayValue() + " at $" + nicePrice + " each \n"); template.print(" Options:\n"); var variables = now_GR.variables.getElements(); for (var key in variables) { var now_V = variables[key]; if(now_V.getQuestion().getLabel() != ) { template.space(4); template.print(' ' + now_V.getQuestion().getLabel() + " = " + now_V.getDisplayValue() + "\n"); } } }

children.name: getLabel()
children.text: Returns the object label.

children.name: String
children.text: Field name.

children.name: Output
children.text:
*** Script: 1.
Field Label: Country code
Field Name: country
Field Value: 
*** Script: 2.
Field Label: Calendar integration
Field Name: calendar_integration
Field Value: Outlook
...
*** Script: 47.
Field Label: First name
Field Name: first_name
Field Value: Fred
...
*** Script: 54.
Field Label: Last name
Field Name: last_name
Field Value: Luddy
...
children.text2:
. Results include 62 fields and have been truncated with ellipsis points (…) to save
        space.

children.name: Example
children.text: var userRec = new GlideRecord("sys_user"); // GlideRecord to sys_user table userRec.get("5137153cc611227c000bbd1bd8cd2005"); // Sys Id of user: Fred Luddy var fields = userRec.getFields(); for (var i = 0; i < fields.size(); i++) { var field = fields.get(i); var name = field.getName(); // Name of the field var label = field.getLabel(); // Label of the field var value = field.getDisplayValue(); // Value of the field gs.info((Number(i) + 1) + ".\n" + "Field Label: " + label + "\n" + "Field Name: " + name + "\n" + "Field Value: " + value); };
children.text2:
The following  shows how to get the name and other values for each field in a
        sys_user record.

children.name: getName()
children.text: Returns the name of the field.

children.name: String
children.text: Table name of the reference.

children.name: Example
children.text: var grINC = new GlideRecord('incident'); grINC.query('number','INC0010041'); // record assignment group assigned to "CAB Approval" if (grINC.next()) { // Get the table name var tableName = grINC.assignment_group.getReferenceTable(); gs.info( tableName ); }

children.name: getReferenceTable()
children.text: Gets the table name for a reference element.

children.name: GlideRecord
children.text: A GlideRecord object

children.name: Example
children.text: var grINC = new GlideRecord('incident'); grINC.addNotNullQuery('caller_id'); grINC.query(); if (grINC.next()) { // Get a GlideRecord object for the referenced sys_user record var grUSER = grINC.caller_id.getRefRecord(); if (grUSER.isValidRecord()) gs.info(grUSER.getValue('name')); }

children.name: getRefRecord()
children.text: Returns a GlideRecord object for a given reference element.
children.text2: Warning: If the reference element does not contain a value, it returns an empty GlideRecord object, not a NULL object.

children.name: String
children.text:
Name of the table. The returned value may be different from the table Class
                that the record is in. See Tables and Classes in the product documentation.

children.name: Example
children.text: if (current.approver.getTableName() == "sysapproval_approver") { if (current.approver == email.from_sys_id) { current.comments = "reply from: " + email.from + "\n\n" + email.body_text; // if it's been cancelled, it's cancelled. var doit = true; if (current.state=='cancelled') doit = false; if (email.body.state != undefined) current.state= email.body.state; if (doit) current.update(); } else { gs.log("Approval for task ("+current.sysapproval.getDisplayValue()+") rejected because user sending email( "+email.from+") does not match the approver ("+current.approver.getDisplayValue()+")"); } }

children.name: getTableName()
children.text: Returns the name of the table on which the field resides.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the field is null.
Possible values:
  • true: Field is null.
  • false: Field is not null.

children.text: false

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); gs.info(glideRecord.state.nil());

children.name: milliseconds
children.text: Number
children.text2: Number of milliseconds since 1/1/1970

children.name: Example
children.text: var now_GR = new GlideRecord("incident"); now_GR.initialize(); now_GR.opened_at.setDateNumericValue(10000);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setDateNumericValue(Number milliseconds)
children.text:
Sets the value of a date/time element to the specified number of milliseconds since
    January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT.
children.text2:
When called, setDateNumericValue() automatically creates the necessary GlideDateTime/GlideDate/GlideDuration object, and then sets the element to the specified value.

Note: Before calling this method, the element must already exist by querying an existing record or by using the now_GR.initialize() method to initialize a new record.

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); //change the urgency to 3 glideRecord.urgency.setDisplayValue('3 - Low'); gs.info(glideRecord.urgency);

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: value
children.text: Object
children.text2: The value to set for the field.

children.name: setDisplayValue(Object value)
children.text: Sets the display value of the field.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: errorMessage
children.text: String
children.text2: The error message.

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); glideRecord.short_description.setError('Error text');

children.name: setError(String errorMessage)
children.text: Adds an error message. Available in Fuji patch 3.

children.name: phoneNumber
children.text: Object
children.text2:
The phone number to set. This can be in either the international or local
                format.

children.name: Output
children.text:
Phone Number: +919812456789
Is phone number specified match the correct format: true

children.name: Example
children.text: setWalkupLocPhone('Santa Clara Tech Lounge','+91 9812456789'); function setWalkupLocPhone(locName, phoneNumber) { var walkupLoc = new GlideRecord('wu_location_queue'); walkupLoc.addQuery('name', locName); walkupLoc.query(); walkupLoc.next(); // Set phone number of walk-up location var isPhoneNumberSet = walkupLoc.phone_number.setPhoneNumber(phoneNumber, true); walkupLoc.update(); gs.info('Phone Number: ' + walkupLoc.phone_number); gs.info('Is phone number specified match the correct format: ' + isPhoneNumberSet); }
children.text2: The following shows how to set the phone number of a walk-up location. This example requires the Walk-up Experience plugin.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the phone number value was set.

Possible values:

  • true: Value was set.
  • false: Value was not set.

children.name: strict
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
When true, specifies that the number specified must match the correct format.
                When false, the system attempts to correct an improperly formatted phone
                number.

children.name: setPhoneNumber(Object phoneNumber, Boolean strict)
children.text: Sets the field to the specified phone number.
children.text2: This method is only available on a phone number GlideElement.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: value
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object value to set the field to.

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); glideRecord.short_description.setValue('Network failure');
children.text2: Set the value passing a string.

children.name: Example
children.text: var now_GR = new GlideRecord(‘student’); now_GR.initialize(); now_GR.setValue('first_name', 'Joe'); now_GR.setValue('last_name', 'Smith'); now_GR.insert();
children.text2: Set the value passing an object.

children.name: setValue(Object value)
children.text: Sets the value of a field.
children.text2: Note: Before calling this method, the element must already exist by querying an existing record or by using the now_GR.initialize() method to initialize a new record.

children.name: Example
children.text: var glideRecord = new GlideRecord('incident'); glideRecord.query('priority','1'); glideRecord.next(); gs.info(glideRecord.opened_at.toString());

children.name: String
children.text: Value as a string.

children.name: toString()
children.text: Converts the value of a GlideRecord field to a string.

name: GlideElement
text: The Scoped GlideElement API provides a number of convenient script methods for dealing with fields and their values. Scoped GlideElement methods are available for the fields of the current GlideRecord.

children.name: Output
children.text: As entered display value: ¥999,999.12

children.name: Example
children.text: var tablename = 'my_currency2_table'; var setcur2 = new GlideRecord(tablename); setcur2.initialize(); setcur2.currency_2_field.setDisplayValue('JPY;999999.1234'); setcur2.insert(); gs.info('As entered display value: ' + setcur2.currency_2_field.getAsEnteredDisplayValue());

children.name: String
children.text: Display currency string as entered by the user.

children.name: getAsEnteredDisplayValue()
children.text:
Returns an FX Currency field display string, as entered by the user, from the associated
    GlideRecord.
children.text2: For additional information on FX Currency fields, see Setting up and operating FX Currency fields.

children.name: Output
children.text: Display Value: ¥999,999.12

children.name: Example
children.text: var tablename = 'my_FXcurrency_table'; var setcur2 = new GlideRecord(tablename); setcur2.initialize(); setcur2.currency_2_field.setDisplayValue('JPY;999999.1234'); setcur2.insert(); gs.info('Display Value: ' + setcur2.currency_2_field.getDisplayValue());

children.name: String
children.text: Display currency value

children.name: getDisplayValue()
children.text:
Returns the display value of an FX Currency field within the associated
    GlideRecord.
children.text2:
Depending on how the display_value is set in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] table, the returned value may be the:

  • Currency value as entered by the user
  • Currency value converted to the session currency (based on the user's locale)
  • Currency value converted to the reference currency

For additional information on FX Currency and the configuration table, see Configure FX Currency global settings.

children.name: Output
children.text: Reference display value: $8,677.99

children.name: Example
children.text: var tablename = 'my_currency2_table'; var setcur2 = new GlideRecord(tablename); setcur2.initialize(); setcur2.currency_2_field.setDisplayValue('JPY;999999.1234'); setcur2.insert(); gs.info('Reference display value: ' + setcur2.currency_2_field.getReferenceDisplayValue());
children.text2:
This  assumes the reference currency code is USD and uses the default conversion
        rate specified in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] table. The output will
        change based on locale.

children.name: String
children.text: Reference currency amount for the associated FX Currency display value.

children.name: getReferenceDisplayValue()
children.text:
Returns the reference currency value of an FX Currency field within the associated
    GlideRecord.
children.text2:
Reference currency is the common currency into which all currency values in a field are converted. The currency code that the getReferenceDisplayValue() method uses to derive the reference currency is based on the following:

  • If an instance record exists, then the method uses the value in the reference_currency field of the FX Currency [fx_currency2_instance] table.
  • If an instance record does not exist, then the method uses the reference currency that would be set on the instance record when the instance record is eventually created (in the following order):
    • If set, the reference_currency in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] table.
    • If set, the reference_currency_source in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] table.
    • System default, system reference currency.

For additional information on the values in the FX Currency Configuration [fx_configuration] table, see Setting up and operating FX Currency fields.

children.name: Output
children.text: Session display value: $8,677.99

children.name: Example
children.text: var tablename = 'my_currency2_table'; var setcur2 = new GlideRecord(tablename); setcur2.initialize(); setcur2.currency_2_field.setDisplayValue('JPY;999999.1234'); setcur2.insert(); gs.info('Session display value: ' + setcur2.currency_2_field.getSessionDisplayValue());
children.text2:
This  assumes the session locale is language code = eng and country code = USA, and
        uses the default conversion rate specified in the FX Currency Configuration
        [fx_configuration] table. The output will change based on locale.

children.name: String
children.text:
Currency value converted to the session currency, which is based on the current
                user's locale.

children.name: getSessionDisplayValue()
children.text:
Returns the session currency value of the associated FX Currency field within the
    current GlideRecord.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: displayValue
children.text: String
children.text2:
Value to set in the FX Currency field in the format <currency code>;<currency amount>. You must format the <currency amount> field in the user's locale.

For example, if the user's locale is USA/eng, the passed in <currency amount> would be 123.45. If the user's local is FRA/fre, the passed in <currency amount> would be 123,45.

children.name: Example
children.text: var tablename = 'my_FXcurrency_table'; var setcur2 = new GlideRecord(tablename); setcur2.initialize(); setcur2.currency_2_field.setDisplayValue('JPY;999,999.1234'); setcur2.insert();

children.name: setDisplayValue(String displayValue)
children.text:
Sets the display value of an FX Currency field with the specified currency
    value.
children.text2: For additional information on FX Currency fields, see Setting up and operating FX Currency fields.

name: GlideElementCurrency2
text: The GlideElementCurrency2 API provides methods to perform operations on Foreign Exchange (FX) Currency fields (also known as Currency2) within the current GlideRecord.
text2:
This API provides methods that enable you to perform the following:
  • Obtain the FX Currency field display string, as entered by the user.
  • Obtain the display value of an FX Currency field.
  • Obtain the reference currency value of an FX Currency field.
  • Obtain the session currency value of an FX Currency field.
  • Set the display value of an FX Currency field.


The GlideElementCurrency2 class has no constructor.

children.name: Output
children.text2: null

children.name: Example
children.text: var grInc = new GlideRecord('incident'); grInc.query('priority', '1'); var field = grInc.getElement('priority'); var ed = field.getED(); var isEdge = ed.getAttachmentEncryptionType(); gs.info(isEdge);

The encryption type used on attachments. Returns null if attachments on the
                element's table are not being encrypted.

children.text: var isRecordValid; var now_GR = new GlideRecord('my_table'); var field = now_GR.getElement('name'); var elementDescriptor = field.getED(); now_GR.query(); while (now_GR.next()) { if (elementDescriptor.isMandatory() && !now_GR.name) { isRecordValid = false; } }
