children.text:
The portal record for the current portal from the Service Portals [sp_portal]
                table.

children.name: getPortalRecord()
children.text: Returns the portal record from the Service Portals [sp_portal] table.

children.name: GlideRecord
children.text:
If parameters are provided, returns the record identified by the provided table and Sys ID.

If no parameters are provided, returns the record identified by the current URL.

Returns null if the widget is embedded by another widget, or if the record for the provided parameters is not found.

children.name: table
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. The table of the record to return. If no parameters are included,
                returns the table and Sys ID identified by the current URL.

children.name: Example
children.text: //Server script (function(){ var now_GR = $sp.getRecord(); data.tableLabel = now_GR.getLabel(); })(); //HTML template <div class="panel-heading"> <h4 class="panel-title">${{{data.tableLabel}} details}</h4> </div>

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. The Sys ID of the record to return. If no parameters are included,
                returns the record identified by the current URL.

children.name: getRecord(String table, String sys_id)
children.text:
If parameters are provided, returns the GlideRecord identified by the provided table
    and Sys ID. If no parameters are provided, returns the record identified by the current URL.

children.text: Returns an array of Service Catalog variables associated with the record in the URL.
children.text2: For example, if the URL includes the parameters id=form&table=sc_req_item&sys_id=832e9620db4f330083766b984b9619cf, the API returns the variables associated with the given record in the Requested item [sc_req_item] table. Must be a record with Service Catalog variables defined, such as a requested item [sc_req_item] record or an incident submitted through a record producer.

An object to pass to the widget's server script. Refer to this object as options in your server script.
Note: Any options passed into this function will only be available in the embedded widget's server script on the first execution of that script. Any subsequent calls into the server script from the embedded widget will not contain the object properties passed in.

children.text2: Form

children.name: mapUrlToSPUrl(String url)
children.text: Transforms a URL requesting a list or form in the platform UI into the URL of the corresponding id=list or id=form Service Portal page.
children.text2:
Use this method to perform tasks such as redirecting a user after login to the correct Service Portal page when they request a platform UI form or list URL. Note that the id=list and id=form page targets are not customizable.

Note: Table, sys_id, and sysparm_query values are preserved from the original URL; sysparm_view is not.

children.name: Example
children.text: function copyAttachmentToGlideRecord(conceptSysId) { // Get record from test_table using sys_id var targetGlideRecord = new GlideRecord("test_table"); if (!targetGlideRecord.get(conceptSysId)) { throw ("Cannot find record created by test with sys_id: " + conceptSysId); } // Get record from sys_attachment table var sourceAttachmentGlideRecord = new GlideRecord('sys_attachment'); sourceAttachmentGlideRecord.query(); sourceAttachmentGlideRecord.next(); // Get field values from retrieved sys_attachment record var fileName = sourceAttachmentGlideRecord.getValue('file_name'); var contentType = sourceAttachmentGlideRecord.getValue('content_type'); var sourceAttachmentSysId = sourceAttachmentGlideRecord.getValue('sys_id'); // Attach sys_attachment record content stream to test_table record var gsa = new GlideSysAttachment(); gsa.writeContentStream( targetGlideRecord, fileName, contentType, gsa.getContentStream(sourceAttachmentSysId)); gs.info("Attachment created"); }

name: GlideSysAttachment
text: The GlideSysAttachment API provides a way to handle attachments.
text2:
Content is returned as a string, not as a byte array when getContent() is called.

Content is returned as a GlideScriptableInputStream object when getContentStream() is called. The GlideScriptableInputStream contains the actual bytes not converted into a String.

Note: This API works for scoped or global applications.

name: GlideSysListControl
text:
The scoped GlideSysListControl class allows you to determine if the New or Edit buttons
  are displayed.

children.name: Example
children.text: gs.include("PrototypeServer"); var ValidatePasswordStronger = Class.create(); ValidatePasswordStronger.prototype = { process : function() { var user_password = request.getParameter("user_password"); var min_len = 8; var rules = "Password must be at least " + min_len + " characters long and contain a digit, an uppercase letter, and a lowercase letter."; if (user_password.length() < min_len) { gs.addErrorMessage("TOO SHORT: " + rules); return false; } var digit_pattern = new RegExp("[0-9]", "g"); if (!digit_pattern.test(user_password)) { gs.addErrorMessage("DIGIT MISSING: " + rules); return false; } var upper_pattern = new RegExp("[A-Z]", "g"); if (!upper_pattern.test(user_password)) { gs.addErrorMessage("UPPERCASE MISSING: " + rules); return false; } var lower_pattern = new RegExp("[a-z]", "g"); if (!lower_pattern.test(user_password)) { gs.addErrorMessage("LOWERCASE MISSING: " + rules); return false; } return true; // password is OK } }

children.name: Example
children.text: function contractNoticeDue() { var now_GR = new GlideRecord("contract"); now_GR.addQuery("u_contract_status", "Active"); now_GR.query(); while (now_GR.next()) { if ((now_GR.u_termination_date <= gs.daysAgo(-90)) && (now_GR.u_contract_duration == "Long")) { now_GR.u_contract_status = "In review"; } else if ((now_GR.u_termination_date <= gs.daysAgo(-50)) && (now_GR.u_contract_duration == "Medium")) { now_GR.u_contract_status = "In review"; } else if ((now_GR.u_termination_date <= gs.daysAgo(-10)) && (now_GR.u_contract_duration == "Short")) { now_GR.u_contract_status = "In review"; } } now_GR.update(); }

        optional parameters.

children.name: instance
children.text: Object/String
children.text2:
GlideRecord object or the sys_id of the record to which this event
                applies.

children.name: parm1
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. String to pass into the event script. This parameter is free-form and depends on the implementation of the event script.

Default: If the instance parameter is a GlideRecord object, then the default is the display value for that GlideRecord (now_GR.getDisplayValue) otherwise it is null.

children.name: parm2
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. String to pass into the event script. This parameter is free-form and depends on the implementation of the event script.

Default: null

children.name: expiration
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional. GlideDateTime object or a date/time type element that specifies the date and time to process the event.

Default: Current date/time

children.name: eventQueueScheduled(String name, Object instance, String parm1, String parm2, Object expiration)
children.text: Queues an event in the event manager.
children.text2: The passed in event schedule information is stored in the Events [sysevent] table. For additional information on events, see Events.

Message identifier. You can locate
                this value in the Key field of the Message [sys_ui_message] table. Note the Key

children.name: Output
children.text: Is the summary &amp; details accurate?

children.name: Example
children.text: var my_message = gs.getEscapedMessage("Is the summary & details accurate?"); alert(my_message);
children.text2:
This  shows the ampersand character being replaced with the equivalent ampersand
        HTML name code.

children.name: String
children.text: UI message with HTML special characters replaced with HTML name codes.

children.name: args
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Optional. List of strings or other values defined by java.text.MessageFormat that replace the variables within the specified message.

For example: gs.getMessage("Abort adding action '{0}', same subflow can't be added twice in this subflow.", current.action.name);

In this example '{0}' is replaced with the content of current.action.name.

Note: The passed in values are not translated. They are inserted verbatim in the message.

children.name: Output
children.text: Abort adding action update record, same &ltsubflow&gt can't be added twice in this subflow.

children.name: Example
children.text: // current.action.name is "update record" var my_message = gs.getEscapedMessage("Abort adding action '{0}', same <subflow> can't be added twice in this subflow.", current.action.name); alert(my_message);
children.text2:
This  shows how to replace a single variable within a message and how the < and >
        symbols in the message are transposed to the corresponding HTML name codes of &lt and
        &gt.

children.name: getEscapedMessage(String id, Array args)
children.text: Retrieves the specified message from the Message [sys_ui_message] table. If the message has HTML special characters, replaces them with the corresponding HTML name codes. For example, & becomes &.
children.text2:
If the specified message identifier (Key) exists in the Message [sys_ui_message] table for the current language, the method returns the translated message with all special characters returned as escape sequences. If the specified message identifier does not exist for the current language, then the method returns the English version of the message with all special characters returned as escape sequences. If the message identifier does not exist in the table, then it returns the message ID.

For additional information about the Message table, see Message table.

Note: If the UI message has a tick ('), there may be issues with the message in the script; to escape the ticks ('), use getMessageS(String, Object).

children.name: id
children.text: String
children.text2:
Message identifier. You can locate this value in the Key field of the Message
                [sys_ui_message] table. Note the Key field may look exactly like the actual
                message.

children.text: var my_message = gs.getMessage("rows will not be updated"); alert(my_message);

children.name: Example
children.text: // current.action.name is "update record" var my_message = gs.getMessage("Abort adding action '{0}', same subflow can't be added twice in this subflow.", current.action.name); alert(my_message);
children.text2: This  shows how to replace a single variable within a message.

children.name: args
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Optional. List of strings or other values defined by java.text.MessageFormat that replace the variables within the specified message.

For example: gs.getMessage("Abort adding action '{0}', same subflow can't be added twice in this subflow.", current.action.name);

In this example '{0}' is replaced with the content of current.action.name.

Note: The passed in values are not translated. They are inserted verbatim in the message.

children.name: Output
children.text: Abort adding action update record, same subflow can't be added twice in schedule users subflow.

children.name: Example
children.text: // current.sub_flow.name is 'schedule users' // current.action.name is "update record" var my_message = gs.getEscapedMessage("Abort adding action '{0}', same subflow can't be added twice in {1} subflow.", [current.action.name, current.sub_flow.name]); alert(my_message);
children.text2: This  shows how to replace multiple variables within a message.

children.name: getMessage(String id, Array args)
children.text:
Retrieves translated messages from the Message [sys_ui_message] table to display in a
    UI.
children.text2:
If the specified message identifier (key) exists in the Message [sys_ui_message] table for the current language, then the method returns the translated message. If the specified message identifier does not exist for the current language, then the method returns the English version of the message. If the message identifier does not exist in the table, then it returns the message ID.

For additional information about the Message table, see Message table

Note: If the UI message has a tick ('), there may be issues with the message in the script; to escape the ticks ('), use getMessageS(String, Object).

                role.

children.name: Example
children.text: if (current.operation() == 'insert') { // If no due date was specified, calculate a default if (current.due_date == '') { if (current.urgency == '1') { // Set due date to 4 hours ahead of current time current.due_date = gs.hoursAgo(-4); } if (current.urgency == '2') { // Set due date to 2 days ahead of current time current.due_date = gs.daysAgo(-2); } if (current.urgency == '3') { // Set due date to 7 days ahead of current time current.due_date = gs.daysAgo(-7); } } }

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the script include worked.
Possible values:
  • true: Script include worked.
  • false: Script include failed.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ldapServer = new GlideRecord("ldap_server_config"); ldapServer.addActiveQuery(); ldapServer.query(); gs.include("LDAPUtils"); var ldapUtils = new LDAPUtils(); var errMsg = ""; while (ldapServer.next()) { var ldap = new GlideLDAP(); var dn = ldapServer.dn; var env = ldap.setup(); if (env == null) { errMsg = "Failed environment setup, missing URL"; gs.eventQueue("ldap.connection_failed", ldapServer, ldapServer.getDisplayValue(), errMsg); gs.logError("LDAP server " + ldapServer.getDisplayValue() + " failed scheduled connection test: " + errMsg, "LDAP"); } }
children.text2: This  gets the LDAPUtils in the current script context.

children.text2: Note: Care should be taken when setting system properties (sys_properties) using this method as it causes a system-wide cache flush. Each flush can cause system degradation while the caches rebuild. If a value must be updated often, it should not be stored as a system property. In general, you should only place values in the sys_properties table that do not frequently change.

name: GlideSystem
text:
The scoped GlideSystem (referred to by the variable name 'gs' in any server-side
  JavaScript) API provides a number of convenient methods to get information about the system, the
  current logged in user, etc.
text2:
Many of the GlideSystem methods facilitate the easy inclusion of dates in query ranges, and are
   most often used in filters and reporting.

The Scoped GlideTableHierarchy API provides methods for handling information about table
  relationships.

children.name: inputStream
children.text: GlideScriptableInputStream
children.text2: The input stream to be read.

children.name: GlideTextReader( GlideScriptableInputStream inputStream)
children.text: Creates a scoped GlideTextReader object for the specified input stream.

children.name: String
children.text: The character encoding of the input stream.

children.name: getEncoding()
children.text: Returns the character encoding of the input stream.

children.name: String
children.text:
A single line of input up to the carriage return. Does not include the carriage
                return. Returns null if there is no content.

children.name: Example
children.text: var is = new GlideSysAttachment().getContentStream(attachmentSysId); var reader = new GlideTextReader(is); var ln = ' '; while((ln = reader.readLine()) != null) { gs.info(ln); }

children.name: readLine()
children.text:
Returns a single line from the input stream and returns a string. Since this is working
    off of a stream, it is not subject to the 5MB size limit.

name: GlideTextReader
text:
Provides the ability to read single lines from an input stream. Because an input stream
  is used, it is not subject to the 5MB attachment size limit.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(); gs.info(gt.getDisplayValue());

children.name: GlideTime()
children.text: Instantiates a GlideTime object with the current time.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(10000); gs.info(gt.getDisplayValue());
children.text2:
This  shows adding 10 seconds to midnight (UTC), which is then adjusted for the time
        zone in which the instance resides. In this case, -8 hours from UTC.

children.name: milliseconds
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Time to add to midnight UTC.

Unit: Milliseconds

children.name: GlideTime(Number milliseconds)
children.text:
Instantiates a GlideTime object with its time starting at midnight UTC plus the passed
    in value.
children.text2: The value is adjusted for the timezone in which the instance resides. For example, if the user's instance is in a time zone that is -8 hours from the UTC, and 1000 is passed in, the time in the GlideTime object is 16:00:10 (00:00:00 - 8 hours +10 seconds.)

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(); gt.setValue('12:00:00'); gs.info(gt.getByFormat("HH:mm"));

children.name: String
children.text: Time in the specified format.

children.name: format
children.text: String
children.text2:
String to use to format the time.
For example, if the current time is 10:30:20 then:
  • hh:mm:ss = 10:30:20
  • HH = 10
  • HH –- ss = 10 –- 20
  • hh a = 10 AM
  • s:m:H ss:mm:hh = 20:30:10 20:30:10
  • HH:mm:ss.SSSZ = 10:30:20.000+0000
  • HH/mm/ss = 10/30/20

children.name: getByFormat(String format)
children.text: Returns the time in the specified format.
children.text2: For information on the time formats that you can pass into this method, see Global date and time field format. You can pass these values in any order and add separators such as a dash, space, backslash, or colon. In addition, you can also pass the character "a" to return am/pm.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(); gt.setDisplayValue("12:00:00"); // User Time Zone gs.info(gt.getDisplayValue()); // User Time Zone

children.name: String
children.text: The time in the user's format and time zone.

children.name: getDisplayValue()
children.text: Gets the time in the current user's display format and time zone.
children.text2: When designing business rules or script includes remember that this method may return values in different formats for different users.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(); gt.setValue("01:00:00"); //Internal Time Zone , UTC gs.info(gt.getDisplayValueInternal()); //User Time Zone

children.name: String
children.text:
The time value for the GlideTime object in the current user's time zone and the
                internal time format of HH:mm:ss.

children.name: getDisplayValueInternal()
children.text:
Gets the display value in the current user's time zone and the internal format
    (HH:mm:ss).

children.name: Number
children.text: The hours using the local time zone.

children.name: getHourLocalTime()
children.text: Returns the hours part of the time using the local time zone.

children.name: Number
children.text:
The hours using the local time zone. The number of hours is based on a 24 hour
                clock.

children.name: getHourOfDayLocalTime()
children.text:
Returns the hours part of the time using the local time zone. The number of hours is
    based on a 24 hour clock.

children.name: Number
children.text:
The hours using the UTC time zone. The number of hours is based on a 24 hour
                clock.

children.name: getHourOfDayUTC()
children.text:
Returns the hours part of the time using the UTC time zone. The number of hours is
    based on a 24 hour clock.

children.name: Number
children.text:
The hours using the UTC time zone. The number of hours is based on a 12 hour
                clock. Noon and midnight are represented by 0, not 12.

children.name: getHourUTC()
children.text:
Returns the hours part of the time using the UTC time zone. The number of hours is
    based on a 12 hour clock. Noon and midnight are represented by 0, not 12.

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of minutes using the local time zone.

children.name: getMinutesLocalTime()
children.text: Returns the number of minutes using the local time zone.

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of minutes in the hour using the UTC time zone.

children.name: getMinutesUTC()
children.text: Returns the number of minutes in the hour based on the UTC time zone.

children.name: Number
children.text: The number of seconds in the minute.

children.name: getSeconds()
children.text: Returns the number of seconds in the current minute.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(); gs.info(gt.getValue()); // Internal Time Zone, UTC

children.name: String
children.text: The time value in the internal fomat and system time zone.

children.name: getValue()
children.text:
Gets the time value stored in the database by the GlideTime object in the internal
    format, HH:mm:ss, and the system time zone.

children.name: Example
children.text: var gt = new GlideTime(); gt.setDisplayValue('01:00:00'); // User Time Zone gs.info(gt.getDisplayValueInternal()); // User Time Zone

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: asDisplayed
children.text: String
children.text2:
The time in the current user's display format and time zone. The parameter must
                be formatted using the current user's preferred display format, such as HH:mm:ss.

children.name: setDisplayValue(String asDisplayed)
children.text: Sets a time value using the current user's display format and time zone.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

name: GlideUICompatibility
text:
The scoped GlideUICompatibility class provides the ability for scoped applications to
  define their own minimum browser versions. This is done by creating system properties for the
  scoped application.
text2:
You create the properties using the sys_properties list and assign a version number. When you do this from the scoped application, the prefix is automatically added to the property name. The scoped application UI compatibility properties are:

  • <scope-name>.ui.ie_minimum
  • <scope-name>.ui.chrome_minimum
  • <scope-name>.ui.firefox_minimum
  • <scope-name>.ui.safari_major_version_minimum


You can then use the scoped GlideUICompatibility class to determine if the current browser is supported.

children.text2:
The identifier that is returned depends on the domain type and the instantiation of that domain.

  • If the user is configured in the global domain, and does not use the domain picker to switch domains, the method returns null.
  • If the user uses the domain picker to switch to the global domain, the method returns the string "global".
  • For all other domains, the method returns the sys_id of that domain.

For scoped applications, the JSON API uses static methods that call the JavaScript ES5 native JSON object.

Note: Use the global keyword with JSON method calls in scoped scripts, for example, global.JSON.stringify(). Not using the global keyword could result in an error message, such as ScopedRhinoObjectWrapper: not a wrappable type: com.glide.script.FieldGlideDescriptor.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: confGR
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord of the conference call to add the specified participant. These
                records are located in the Notify Conference Call [notify_conference_call]
                table.

children.name: addToConferenceByUserId(String userId, GlideRecord confGR)
children.text:
Adds a participant to the conference call referenced by the passed in GlideRecord using
    their unique user identifier.

children.name: action
children.text: String
children.text2:
Defines the conference call action to perform.
The following are the available conference call actions:
  • start: Starts the conference call identified in data.confId
  • end: Terminates the conference call identified in data.confId
  • join: Adds the participant specified in the data.items array to the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiJoin: Adds the participants specified in the data.items array to the conference call identified in data.confId
  • selfJoin: Adds the currently logged in user to the conference call (no entry in data.items required.)
  • kick: Removes the participant specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiKick: Removes the participants specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId
  • mute: Mutes the participant specified in the data.items array on the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiMute: Mutes the participants specified in the data.items array on the conference call identified in data.confId
  • unmute: Unmutes the participant specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiUnmute: Unmutes the participants specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: Example
children.text: (function (confId) { var confUtils = new NotifyConferenceUtils(); var data = confUtils.getConferenceInputDataTemplate(); data.table = 'incident'; data.sysId = '1234'; data.addToWorkNotes = false; data.confId = confId; data.message = 'p1 incident has been created'; data.fromNumber = 'twilio/Telephony driver number'; data.items.push({ id: 'user3SysId', phoneNumber: '+917799555332' }); data.items.push({ id: 'user4SysId', email: 'yln99518@gmail.com' }); var result = confUtils.doConferenceAction('start', data); if (result.status) { gs.info('Start conference action succeeded'); } else gs.info('Start conference action failed'); result.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); result.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); result.successMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); })('activeConfSysId');

children.name: data
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: data.addToWorkNotes
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to add information about the participants that were included in the conference call in the work notes field of the associated record.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record in which to add the work notes.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin

children.name: data.allowMulticonference
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to allow multiple conference calls for a specific record at one time.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record that is allowed to have multiple conference calls.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.confId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys ID of the conference call.

The conference Sys ID is located in the Notify Conference Call [notify_conference_call] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • end
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin
Note: Participant actions such as mute, unmute, and kick do not require this parameter to be set as the method obtains this information from the Notify Conference Call Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: data.fromNumber
children.text: String
children.text2:
Service provider number to call into for the conference call.

Locate this value in the Number or Phone number column of the Notify Phone Number [notify_number] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • start

children.name: data.isNewConference
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether this is a new or an existing conference call.

Valid values:

  • true: New conference call
  • false: Existing conference call

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.items
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Information for each participant to include in the conference call.

Valid array values:

  • id: Sys ID of user; located in the User [sys_User] table.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • notifyParticipantId: Sys ID of the Notify participant; located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

    Valid actions: join, kick, multiJoin, mute, start, unmute

  • phoneNumber: Phone number of the participant. If this value is passed in conjunction with either the id or notifyParticipantId, this value supersedes the phone numbers in the user/participant record and is used to place the call.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • email: Email address of the participant.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

children.name: data.message
children.text: String
children.text2:
Message that is read aloud when a user answers the call, such as, "P1 incident has been created please login to instance."

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin

children.name: data.serviceProvider
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Name of conference service provider, such as Zoom or Webex.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • all

children.name: data.sysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys ID of the source record to associate with the conference call.

For example, if a conference call is held to discuss a specific incident or problem, put the Sys ID of the incident or problem record in this value. This Sys ID is stored in the Source column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can later be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.Table, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.table
children.text: String
children.text2:
Table that contains the source record to associate with the conference call. A source record can be any record, such as an "incident" or "problem", that is the topic of discussion in the conference call.

This table name is stored in the Table column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.sysId, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: doConferenceAction(String action, Object data)
children.text:
Performs the specified conference call action, such as starting/ending a conference
    call or joining, removing, muting, or unmuting participants from a conference call.
children.text2:
You can start a new conference call and add participants within a single call to this method or call the method multiple times to start the call and then manage participants separately. In addition, through the passed in data object, you can configure the method to:

  • Save pointers in the conference call record to the specific record (source record), such as an incident or problem, that is the topic of discussion for the conference call.
  • Allow/disallow multiple conference calls for a source record.
  • Automatically log the participants that were in the conference call in the "Work Notes" field of the source record.
  • Have a message read aloud when a participant answers an outgoing call from the conference.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function (confId) { var confUtils = new NotifyConferenceUtils(); var data = confUtils.getConferenceInputDataTemplate(); data.confId = confId; var result = confUtils.doConferenceAction('end', data); if (result.status) { gs.info('Conference call has been ended'); } else gs.info('End conference call action failed'); result.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); result.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); result.successMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); })('activeConfSysId');

children.name: data
children.text: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: data.addToWorkNotes
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether to add information about the participants that were included in the conference call in the work notes field of the associated record.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record in which to add the work notes.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin

children.name: data.allowMultconference
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether to allow multiple conference calls for a specific record at one time.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record that is allowed to have multiple conference calls.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.confId
children.text:
Sys ID of the conference call.

The conference Sys ID is located in the Notify Conference Call [notify_conference_call] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • end
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin
Note: Participant actions such as mute, unmute, and kick do not require this parameter to be set as the method obtains this information from the Notify Conference Call Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: data.fromNumber
children.text:
Service provider number to call into for the conference call.

Locate this value in the Number or Phone number column of the Notify Phone Number [notify_number] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • start

children.name: data.isNewConference
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this is a new or an existing conference call.

Valid values:

  • true: New conference call
  • false: Existing conference call

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.items
children.text:
Information for each participant to include in the conference call.

Valid array values:

  • id: Sys ID of user; located in the User [sys_User] table.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • notifyParticipantId: Sys ID of the Notify participant; located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

    Valid actions: join, kick, multiJoin, mute, start, unmute

  • phoneNumber: Phone number of the participant. If this value is passed in conjunction with either the id or notifyParticipantId, this value supersedes the phone numbers in the user/participant record and is used to place the call.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • email: Email address of the participant.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

children.name: data.message
children.text:
Message that is read aloud when a user answers the call, such as, "P1 incident has been created please login to instance."

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin

children.name: data.serviceProvider
children.text:
Required. Name of conference service provider, such as Zoom or Webex.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • all

children.name: data.sysId
children.text:
Sys ID of the source record to associate with the conference call.

For example, if a conference call is held to discuss a specific incident or problem, put the Sys ID of the incident or problem record in this value. This Sys ID is stored in the Source column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can later be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.Table, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.table
children.text:
Table that contains the source record to associate with the conference call. A source record can be any record, such as an "incident" or "problem", that is the topic of discussion in the conference call.

This table name is stored in the Table column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.sysId, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: getConferenceInputDataTemplate()
children.text: Returns a JSON data template to use with the doConferenceAction() method. Using this template automatically structures the data object so that you don't have to manually create it.
children.text2:
Call this method prior to calling the doConferenceAction() method. For the desired conference call action, set the desired parameters within the template, and then pass the template in the doConferenceAction() call. For additional information on the valid parameters for each action, see doConferenceAction().

Note: This is a helper method. You can also manually construct this object and pass that object into the doConferenceAction() method and have the same outcome.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Key-value pairs of the status of each driver capability.

Valid values:

  • isSupported = 0: capability is not supported
  • isSupported = 1: capability is supported

children.name: Output
children.text2:
The method returns a node similar to the following for each active telephony
        service provider within the instance.

children.name: Example
children.text: (function () { var confUtils = new NotifyConferenceUtils(); var providerToCapability = confUtils.getServiceProvidersCapabilites(); for (var provider in providerToCapability) { gs.info('{0} supported capabilities \n\n', provider); var capabilities = providerToCapability[provider] for (var cap in capabilities) if(confUtils.isActionSupported(capabilities[cap].isSupported)) gs.info('"{0}" action supported', cap); else gs.info("'{0}' action is not supported by this conference driver", cap); } })();
children.text2: List driver capabilities for all telephony service provider drivers in the instance.

children.name: getServiceProvidersCapabilities()
children.text:
Returns the capabilities of all telephony service provider drivers in the
    instance.
children.text2:
Possible capabilities include:

  • archive: archives the conference after it ends
  • beepOnLeave: plays a "beep" tone when a participant leaves the conference call
  • beepOnJoin: plays a "beep" tone when a participant joins the conference call
  • end: ends the identified conference call
  • filesharing: allows file sharing between participants
  • join: adds a participant to a conference call
  • kick: removes a participant from a conference call
  • multiJoin: adds multiple participants to a conference call
  • multiKick: removes multiple participants from a conference call
  • muteOnJoin: mutes a participant when they initially join a conference call
  • multiUnmute: unmutes multiple participants for a conference call
  • record: records conference calls
  • recording: provides an on-screen indicator when the conference call is being recorded
  • screenSharing: allows participant screens to be shared with the group
  • selfJoin: adds the current logged in user to a conference call
  • speaking: provides an on-screen message as to who is currently speaking
  • start: starts the identified conference call
  • unmute: unmutes a participant in a conference call

children.name: Example
children.text: (function () { var confUtils = new NotifyConferenceUtils(); var providerToCapability = confUtils.getServiceProvidersCapabilites(); for (var provider in providerToCapability) { gs.info('{0} supported capabilities \n\n', provider); var capabilities = providerToCapability[provider] for (var cap in capabilities) if (confUtils.isActionSupported(capabilities[cap].isSupported)) gs.info('"{0}" action supported', cap); else gs.info("'{0}' action is not supported by this conference driver", cap); } })();

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the telephony service provider supports the specified action.

Valid values:

  • true: action is supported by the service provider
  • false: action is not supported by the service provider

children.name: action
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Value of the isSupported parameter returned by the getServiceProvidersCapabilities() method for a specific action and service provider.

Note: Although the isSupported value may appear to be a Boolean, it is actually a Number. Do not try and evaluate the capabilities as Boolean values. Use this method as the associated values may be expanded in future versions.

children.name: isActionSupported(Number action)
children.text:
Determines whether a Notify conference action is supported by a telephony service
    provider.
children.text2:
To use this method, you must first call the getServiceProviderCapabilities() method. This method returns an object that contains information about the availability of each possible Notify conference action for each service provider configured in your instance.

For example:

{
    "Telephony": {
        "start": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "end": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "selfJoin": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "join": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "multiJoin": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "mute": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "multiMute": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "unmute": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "multiUnmute": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "kick": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "multiKick": {
            "isSupported": 1,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "record": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "speaking": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "recording": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "screenSharing": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "fileSharing": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "archive": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "muteOnJoin": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "beepOnJoin": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        },
        "beepOnLeave": {
            "isSupported": 0,
            "meta": {}
        }
    }
}

children.name: Example
children.text: (function () { var confUtils = new NotifyConferenceUtils(); var participantGR = new GlideRecord('notify_participant'); // Participant record contains conf call ID participantGR.get('validParticipantSysId'); var actionResult = confUtils.kickByParticipantGR(participantGR); if (actionResult.status) gs.info('Participant has been kicked out of conference'); else { gs.info('kick operation failed'); actionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); actionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }) } })()

children.name: notifyParticipantGR
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord object of the participant to remove from the conference call. These
                records are located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: kickByParticipantGR(GlideRecord notifyParticipantGR)
children.text:
Removes the participant associated with the passed in GlideRecord from the current
    conference call.

children.name: notifyParticipantGR
children.text: Object
children.text2:
GlideRecord object of the participant to mute. These records are located in the
                Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: Example
children.text: (function () { var confUtils = new NotifyConferenceUtils(); var participantGR = new GlideRecord('notify_participant'); participantGR.get('validSysId'); var actionResult = confUtils.muteByParticipantGR(participantGR); if (actionResult.status) gs.info('Participant has been muted'); else { gs.info('mute operation failed'); actionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }); actionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { gs.info(msg); }) } })()

children.name: muteByParticipantGR(GlideRecord notifyParticipantGR)
children.text:
Mutes the participant associated with the passed in GlideRecord on the current
    conference call.

children.name: notifyParticipantGR
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord object of the participant to unmute. These records are located in
                the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

name: NotifyConferenceUtil - Scoped, Global
text: The NotifyConferenceUtil API provides methods to manage Notify conference calls and SMS messages for various telephony service providers, such as Zoom and WebEx.
text2:
Using the NotifyConferenceUtil API you can:

  • Create new conference calls
  • Add participants by phone number or user ID
  • Remove participants from a conference call
  • Mute participants in a conference call
  • Unmute participants in a conference call
  • Obtain the capabilities of a specified service provider
  • End a conference call


You can use this API in both scoped and global scripts. To use this API you must activate the Conference Notify plugin (com.snc.notify) which requires a separate subscription. For details on activating this plugin, see Activate Notify.

children.name: Optional
children.text: Object used to interact with a single record.

children.name: reason
children.text: String
children.text2: Optional. Reason displayed in the log when Optional.get() is called on the empty Optional object.

children.name: Output
children.text: NiceError: [2020-08-26T23:23:37.402Z]: get() called on empty Optional: no results

children.name: Example
children.text: var now_GR = new GlideRecord('task'); now_GR.addQuery('approval', 'not requested'); now_GR.query(); var optional; if (now_GR.next()) { optional = Optional.of(now_GR.getUniqueValue()); } else { optional = Optional.empty("no results"); } gs.info(optional.get());
children.text2:
This  shows you how to generate an empty Optional object when a query does not
        return a result.

children.name: empty(String reason)
children.text:
Returns an empty Optional object. Use this method in an Else clause to handle a query
    that might not return a result.
children.text2: Note: This method is static. You do not need an instance of the class to use this method.

children.name: predicate
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Predicate function to apply to the value inside the Optional object. Must
                return a Boolean value.

children.name: Example
children.text: var filteredQuery = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .getBy({ sys_id: 'f682abf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5d38' }, ['phone']) .filter(function (user) { return phoneRegex.test(user.phone); });
children.text2: This  shows you how to apply a filter function to an Optional result.

children.name: Optional
children.text: Object used to interact with a single record.

children.name: filter(Function predicate)
children.text:
Applies a predicate function, a function that takes a single value and returns true or
    false, to the record inside the Optional object. If the function returns true, the method
    returns the Optional record unchanged. If the function returns false, it returns an empty
    Optional object.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: new global.GlideQuery('alm_asset') .whereNotNull('owned_by') .selectOne('owned_by') .flatMap(function (asset) { return new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .getBy({ sys_id: asset.owned_by }, ['first_name', 'last_name', 'company.name']) }) .ifPresent(GQ.jsonDebug);
children.text2:
This  shows how to execute a query of the User table based on the result of a
        previous query.

children.name: Optional
children.text: Object used to interact with a single record.

children.name: fn
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Function
                to apply to the results of the query that returned the Optional
                object.

children.name: flatMap(Function fn)
children.text:
Applies a function that returns an Optional object to the result of a query. Use this
    method to perform a second query using the result of the first.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var value = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .selectOne('first_name') //Returns the result of the query inside an Optional object .get(); //Calls Optional.get() on the Optional object gs.info(JSON.stringify(value));
children.text2: This  shows how to get the value of a single record.

children.name: Any
children.text:
The record inside the Optional object. If the value is null or undefined, the
                system throws an error.

children.name: get()
children.text:
Returns the record inside the Optional object, or throws an error if the query does not
    return a record.

children.name: fn
children.text: Function
children.text2: The function to apply to the record within the Optional object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var user = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .where('sys_id', 'f682abf03710200044e0bfc8bcbe5d38') .selectOne('zip') .ifPresent(function (user) { gs.info('Zip Code: ' + user.zip); });
children.text2: This  shows how to print a value if it exists.

children.name: ifPresent(Function fn)
children.text:
Applies a function to the record within an Optional object. If the Optional object does
    not contain a record, the function does not execute.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the result of a query contains a value.

Valid values:
  • true: The query returns null or undefined.
  • false: The query returns a value.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkEmpty = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .where('last_name', 'Barker') .selectOne() .isEmpty(); gs.info(checkEmpty);
children.text2: This  shows how to check whether the result of a query is empty.

children.name: isEmpty()
children.text: Returns true if the Optional object is empty.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the result of a query contains a value.

Valid values:
  • true: The query returns a value.
  • false: The query returns null or undefined.

children.name: Output
children.text: true

children.name: Example
children.text: var checkPresent = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .where('last_name', 'Luddy') .selectOne('first_name') .isPresent(); gs.info(checkPresent);
children.text2: This  shows how to check whether a query returns a result.

children.name: isPresent()
children.text: Checks whether an Optional object contains a value.

children.name: lazyGetFn
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Function that returns a single record as a result of a query. For example: 
var userGr = new GlideRecord('sys_user');

children.name: Output
children.text: Optional<005d500b536073005e0addeeff7b12f4>

children.name: Example
children.text: var userOptional = global.Optional.lazy(function () { var userGr = new GlideRecord('sys_user'); userGr.setLimit(1); userGr.query(); return userGr.next() ? userGr.getUniqueValue() : null; }); gs.info(userOptional);
children.text2: This  shows how to get an Optional object based on a GlideRecord query.

children.name: Optional
children.text: Object containing the result of the query in the format Optional<result>.

children.name: lazy(Function lazyGetFn)
children.text:
Returns a new Optional object. Instead of containing the record, the object contains a
    function to get the record that is only called if and when requested in the code.
children.text2:
Use this method to delay getting the value until it's needed. You might do this if requesting the value from a slow source and don't want to slow down your code unnecessarily. Otherwise, you can return an Optional object using the GlideQuery and Stream APIs.

Note: This method is static. You do not need an instance of the class to use this method.

children.name: Output
children.text: Optional<ABEL>

children.name: Example
children.text: var value = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .whereNotNull('first_name') .selectOne('first_name') .map(function (user) { return user.first_name.toUpperCase(); }); gs.info(value);
children.text2:
This  shows how to apply a function that transforms a value to upper case to the
        result of a query.

children.name: Optional
children.text: Object containing the results of the query updated by the function in the format Optional<result>.

children.name: fn
children.text: Function
children.text2: Function to apply to the result of the query.

children.name: map(Function fn)
children.text: Applies a function to the result of a query.

children.name: value
children.text: Any
children.text2: Value inside the Optional object.

children.name: Example
children.text: var now_GR = new GlideRecord('task'); now_GR.addQuery('approval', 'not requested'); now_GR.query(); var optional; if (now_GR.next()) { optional = Optional.of(now_GR.getUniqueValue()); } else { optional = Optional.empty("no results"); } gs.info(optional.get());
children.text2: This  shows you how to generate an Optional object based on a GlideRecord query.

children.name: Optional
children.text: Object containing the passed-in value in the format Optional<value>.

children.name: of(Any value)
children.text:
Wraps a given value in an Optional object. For example, you can wrap the result of a
    GlideRecord query in an Optional object to use the associated methods.
children.text2: Note: This method is static. You do not need an instance of the class to use this method.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var user = new global.GlideQuery('sys_user') .get('1234', ['first_name', 'last_name']) .orElse({ first_name: 'Default', last_name: 'User' }); gs.info(JSON.stringify(user))
children.text2: This  shows how to return a value, even when the query is incorrect.

children.name: Any
children.text:
Value within the Optional object if the query does not return any
                results.

children.name: defaultValue
children.text: Any
children.text2:
Value within the Optional object if the query does not return any
                results.

children.name: orElse(Any defaultValue)
children.text:
Adds a default value within the Optional object if the query does not return any
    results.

name: Optional
text: The Optional API interacts with a single record returned by the GlideQuery, Stream, or GlideRecord APIs, even when it does not exist. Write scripts that are less likely to result in an error by handling null or undefined query results.
text2:
You can get an Optional object in these ways:

  • Return an Optional object from these methods in the GlideQuery class. For more information, see GlideQuery.
    • getBy()
    • get()
    • insert()
    • insertOrUpdate()
    • update()
    • selectOne()
    • avg()
    • max()
    • min()
    • sum()
  • Return an Optional object from the find() method in the Stream class. For more information on Stream, see the Stream API.
  • Use the lazy() method to generate the value of the Optional if ever needed.


These methods are static and do not require an instance of the class:

  • lazy()
  • of()
  • empty()


You can use these static methods with any API that returns a single value such as GlideRecord.

Use the Optional API in scoped or global server-side scripts. This API requires the GlideQuery [com.sn_glidequery] plugin.

Implementation

This API can work with the GlideQuery and Stream APIs in a builder pattern where the method calls chain together, each method building on the returned result of the previous method. Use methods to define the attributes of the query. The methods do not execute until you call a terminal method, a method that returns a query result, allowing you to define the requirements of the query before executing it.

If the query returns a single record, the system wraps the result in an Optional object. If the query returns a stream of records, the system wraps the result in a Stream object. These objects let you manage the result using a set of methods in each API.

For example, here's a script that performs a query on the Task table and groups the records by priority and returns groups with total reassignments greater than four.

var query = new global.GlideQuery('task')
    .where('active', true) //Returns new GlideQuery object with a "where" clause.
    .groupBy('priority') //Returns new GlideQuery object with a "group by" clause.
    .aggregate('sum', 'reassignment_count') //Returns new GlideQuery object with a "sum(reassignment_count)" clause.
    .having('sum', 'reassignment_count', '>', 4) //Returns new GlideQuery object with a "having reassignment_count > 4" clause.
    .select() //Returns a stream of records wrapped in a Stream object.  
    .toArray(10); //Terminal method in the Stream class that executes the query and returns the result.


Terminal methods

For performance reasons, a query only fetches data when you call a terminal method. These are the terminal methods from the Optional class:

  • get()
  • orElse()
  • ifPresent()
  • isEmpty()
  • isPresent()

children.name: uuid
children.text: String
children.text2:
Enter a colon-separated list of sys_id values to specify which indicators, breakdowns, aggregates, and domains to query. The parameter follows this format:

<indicator_sys_id>:<breakdown_sys_id>:<elements_filter_sys_id or element_sys_ids>:<lvl-2 breakdown_sys_id>:<lvl-2 elements_filter_sys_id or element_sys_ids>:<aggregate_sys_id>;<domain_sys_id>

The parameter must begin with the sys_id of an indicator record. Optionally, you can append the sys_id values of a breakdown and breakdown element to group the response based on the breakdown, and the sys_id of an aggregate to apply that aggregate. You can use a breakdown with an aggregate, or use only one.

For information about obtaining the sys_id values of records, see Unique record identifier (sys_id).

Note: If an indicator is configured to use a Default time series, all Analytics Hub values for that indicator use that time series aggregation.

children.name: Example
children.text: var sc = new SNC.PAScorecard(); //in a scoped app, do not use the SNC namespace sc.addParam('uuid', 'fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4'); // Number of open incidents sc.addParam('breakdown', '0df47e02d7130100b96d45a3ce610399'); // by Priority var result = sc.query(); // Query results, which are returned as an object for (var i = 0; i < result.length; i++) gs.info(result[i].name + ': ' + result[i].value + ' ' + result[i].unit.display_value);
children.text2:
In this , the uuid parameter specifies the Number of open incidents indicator, and
        the breakdown parameter specifies the Priority breakdown. Both parameters have the sys_id of
        the respective records as their values. The query() function returns the results as an
        object.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: breakdown
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys_id of a breakdown to return chart information organized as defined by the breakdown. For example, the sys_id of a priority breakdown to return separate task chart information for each priority value, such as the number of open incidents / Priority / 2 - High.

Data type: String

children.name: breakdown_relation
children.text: String
children.text2: Specify the sys_id of a breakdown relation to break down the returned data using that relation. You can view available breakdown relations by setting the include_available_breakdowns parameter to true.

children.name: elements_filter
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specify the sys_id of an elements filter to apply that filter to the returned
                data.

children.name: display
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates the type of indicators to return.
Valid values:
  • true: Return only indicators that display on the Analytics Hub.
  • all: Return all indicators.

Data type: String

Default: true

children.name: favorites
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return only indicators that are favorites of the querying user.
Valid values:
  • true: Return only indicators that are favorites of the querying user.
  • false: Return all indicators.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: key
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return results only for key indicators.
Valid values:
  • true: Return the trendline_scores element.
  • false: Do not return the trendline_scores element .

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: target
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return results only for indicators that have a target set on the Analytics Hub.
Valid values:
  • true: Only return results for indicators that have a target set.
  • false: Return results for all applicable indicators.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: contains
children.text: String
children.text2:
Comma-separated list of names or descriptions to return results only from indicators with a matching value. All the comma-separated list items must match, or no results are returned: The list follows AND logic, not OR logic.

Data type: String

children.name: tags
children.text: String
children.text2: Enter an indicator group sys_id to return the indicators in that group. Do not use uuid with this parameter.

children.name: per_page
children.text: String
children.text2:
Maximum number of indicators each query can return on a page.

Data type: Number

Default: 10

Maximum: 100

children.name: page
children.text: String
children.text2: Specify the page number. For example, when querying 20 indicators in the Analytics Hub with the default per_page value (10), specify a page value of 2 to retrieve the Analytics Hub for 11-20.

children.name: sortby
children.text: String
children.text2:
Value to use when sorting results.
Valid values:
  • bullet
  • change
  • changeperc
  • date
  • default
  • direction
  • duedate
  • frequency
  • gap
  • gapperc
  • group
  • indicator_group
  • name
  • order
  • target
  • trend
  • value

Data type: String

Default: value

children.name: sortdir
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sort direction.
Valid values:
  • asc: Denotes ascending
  • des: Denotes descending

Data type: String

Default: Descending

children.name: display_value
children.text: String
children.text2:
Data retrieval operation for reference and choice fields.
Based on this value, the display value and/or the actual value in the database are retrieved.
  • true returns display values for all of the fields.
  • false returns actual values from the database. If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false.
  • all returns both actual and display values.

children.name: exclude_reference_link
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to hide additional information provided for reference fields, such as the URI to the reference resource.
Valid values:
  • true: Hide additional information provided for reference fields.
  • false: Do not hide additional information provided for reference fields.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: include_scores
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return indicator scores for the entire time range selected on the Analytics Hub. If a value is not specified, this parameter defaults to false and returns only the most recent score value.

To constrain the date range of the scores that are returned, combine this parameter with the from and to parameters.

children.name: from
children.text: String
children.text2:
Earliest date to return scores from. Only scores from this date or later are returned.

This parameter requires that include_scores is set to true.

children.name: to
children.text: String
children.text2:
Latest date from which to return scores. Only scores from this date or earlier are returned.

This parameter requires that include_scores is set to true.

children.name: step
children.text: String
children.text2:
Numeric value to skip scores, based on the indicator frequency. For example, specify a value of 3 to return only scores from every third day for a daily indicator, or from every third week for a weekly indicator.

Data type: Number

children.name: limit
children.text: String
children.text2:
Maximum number of scores to return.

Data type: Number

children.name: include_available_breakdowns
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return all available breakdowns for an indicator.
Valid values:
  • true: Return all available breakdowns for an indicator.
  • false: Return no breakdowns.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: include_available_aggregates
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return all possible aggregates for an indicator, including aggregates that have already been applied.
Valid values:
  • true: Return all possible aggregates for an indicator, including aggregates that have already been applied.
  • false: Return no aggregates.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: include_realtime
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return the realtime_enabled element which indicates if real-time scores are enabled for the indicator, and the realtime_value element which contains the real-time score value. This parameter is not supported for formula indicators.
Valid values:
  • true: Return the realtime_enabled element.
  • false: Do not return the realtime_enabled element.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: include_target_color_scheme
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return the target_color_scheme element that contains the minimum and maximum values, and the color of each section of the target color scheme for the Analytics Hub.
Valid values:
  • true: Return the target_color_scheme element.
  • false: Do not return the target_color_scheme element.

Data type: Boolean

Default: false

children.name: include_forecast_scores
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return the forecast_scores element that contains an array of date-value pairs that define the forecast data for the Analytics Hub.

This paramater requires that the include_scores parameter is also set to true.

children.name: include_trendline_scores
children.text: String
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to return the trendline_scores element that contains an array of date-value pairs that define the Analytics Hub trendline.

This paramater requires that the include_scores parameter is also set to true.

children.name: addParam(String parameter, String value)
children.text: Add a query parameter to filter the returned scores.
children.text2:
Call this method multiple times on the same PAScorecard object to pass multiple parameters, such as the indicator sys_id and a breakdown sys_id. After specifying all parameters, call query() to run the query.

If you query a PAScorecard object with no parameters, the API returns a list of all indicators that are displayed on the Analytics Hub, with their scores.

children.name: Object
children.text: The PAScorecard object.

children.name: query()
children.text:
Perform a query based on the specified parameters and return the results as an
    object.
children.text2: Before calling this method, configure parameters for the PAScorecard object by calling addParam(String parameter, String value).

children.name: Object
children.text: The results from the last query, returned as a JS object.

children.name: result()
children.text: Get the last query result as an object.
children.text2:
This method does not perform a query. To perform a query before returning the result, use query().

This function cannot run in a scope other than global.

name: PAScorecard
text:
The PAScorecard API enables you to fetch data about indicators and their associated
    records, such as breakdowns.
text2: This API requires the Performance Analytics (com.snc.pa.analytics_center) application. For more information, see Performance Analytics.

children.name: Example
children.text: var snapshot2 = PASnapshot.getCompareIDs('fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4', 20160430, 20160531, 'shared'); gs.info(snapshot2);

children.name: String
children.text: A comma-separated list of sys_id values.

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The indicator sys_id.

children.name: date1
children.text: Number
children.text2: The date of the first snapshot, in the format yyyymmdd.

children.name: date2
children.text: Number
children.text2: The date of the second snapshot, in the format yyyymmdd.

children.name: type
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specifies what data to retrieve. Valid values are:
  • all1: all records in the first snapshot
  • all2: all records in the second snapshot
  • shared: records that are in both snapshots
  • movedin: records that are in the first snapshot, but not the second
  • movedout: records that are in the second snapshot, but not the first

children.name: getCompareIDs(String sys_id, Number date1, Number date2, String type)
children.text:
Compare records in snapshots for a specified indicator at multiple dates, such as to
    identify records included in one snapshot but not the other.

children.name: Output
children.text2:
*** Script: {"view":"","query":"sys_idINjavascript:new
        PAUtils().getCompareSnapshotIDs(\"fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4\",\"20160530\",\"20160531\",\"all1\")","table":"incident"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var snapshot4 = PASnapshot.getCompareQuery('fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4', 20160530, 20160531, 'all1'); gs.info(snapshot4);

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The indicator sys_id.

children.name: String
children.text: The table, view, and encoded query as a JSON string.

children.name: date1
children.text: Number
children.text2: The date of the first snapshot, in the format yyyymmdd.

children.name: date2
children.text: Number
children.text2: The date of the second snapshot, in the format yyyymmdd.

children.name: type
children.text: String
children.text2:
Specifies what data to retrieve. Valid values are:
  • all1: all records in the first snapshot
  • all2: all records in the second snapshot
  • shared: records that are in both snapshots
  • movedin: records that are in the second snapshot, but not the first
  • movedout: records that are in the first snapshot, but not the second

children.name: getCompareQuery(String sys_id, Number date1, Number date2, String type)
children.text:
Get the query used to compare records in snapshots for a specified indicator at
    multiple dates.

children.name: Example
children.text: var snapshot1 = PASnapshot.getIDs('fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4', 20160530); gs.info(snapshot1);

children.name: String
children.text: A comma-separated list of sys_id values.

children.text2: The indicator sys_id.

children.text: Number
children.text2: The date when the snapshot was taken, in the format yyyymmdd.

children.name: getIDs(String sys_id, Number date)
children.text:
Get the sys_id values for all records contained in the snapshot for a specified
    indicator at the specified date.

children.name: sys_id
children.text: String
children.text2: The indicator sys_id.

children.name: Output
children.text2:
*** Script: {"view":"","query":"sys_idINjavascript:new
        PAUtils().getSnapshotIDs(\"fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4\",\"20160530\")","table":"incident"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var snapshot3 = PASnapshot.getQuery('fb007202d7130100b96d45a3ce6103b4', 20160530); gs.info(snapshot3);

children.name: String
children.text: The table, view, and encoded query as a JSON string.

children.name: date
children.text: Number

children.name: getQuery(String sys_id, Number date)
children.text:
Get the query used to generate the snapshot for a specified indicator at the specified
    date.

name: PASnapshot
text: The PASnapshot API enables you to query information about Performance Analytics snapshots. Snapshots are the lists of records (sys_ids) that are collected at the time that the scores for those records are collected. A snapshot is made only for automated indicators with Collect records selected.
text2:
You can query information about a snapshot at a certain date using the indicator sys_id and
      date, and perform comparisons between snapshots for an indicator at different dates.

children.name: String
children.text: Returns the encoded query from the URL sent to the form.

children.name: getEncodedQuery()
children.text: Returns the encoded query from the URL sent to the page.

children.name: ScopedSysListControl object
children.text: The list control object for the page.

children.name: getListControl()
children.text: Returns the list control object for the page.

children.name: String
children.text: The parameter's value.

children.name: parameterName
children.text: String

children.name: getParameterValue(String parameterName)
children.text: Returns the value of the specified URL parameter.

children.name: String

children.name: getReferringURL()
children.text: Returns the URL where the request originated.

children.text: Name of the view being used.

children.text: function onLoad() { var viewname=g_form.getViewName(); if(viewname==Mobile) { // If mobile, hide the resolution code g_form.setDisplay('close_code',false); } }
children.text2: The following sample code uses the getViewName() method to check whether to hide the resolution code field when the view is "Mobile".

children.text: Returns true if the page is part of Studio.

Returns true if this is an interactive session. An interactive session is when a user
